And for those of you who have been to Lemonade, you know that the portions aren't the biggest here.

Anyways, I was willing to give the food a fair chance.  Sadly, did not live up to expectations.  Even if I don't take account the priciness of it, I probably wouldn't order half of the things I got.  Meatballs were ok (nothing noteworthy), chicken was bland, salad was simple.  I would however get the blood orange lemonade again! Super tasty, especially for a hot day.
author: Michelle B.

description: Was in town for a conference across the street at the Marriott Marquis and decided to stop in for lunch. Tried the Spicy Fin Ahi Tuna Poké bowl which was awesome, along with the Watermelon Rosemary lemonade. The white truffle mac & cheese tasted pretty bland though. On the whole, the food may seem a little pricey but I thought they used good ingredients and I guess it's also because of its central location. Will be back!
author: Adelie S.

description: The lemonade is really good, as is the vegan brownie. I was less impressed with the broccoli salad and Mac and cheese
author: Sarag G.

description:
I used to love getting Lemonade in LA but I think the price has increased over the year and getting a full meal here will definitely put a dent in your wallet. 

The concept is fairly simple with its cafeteria style design. You start at the The Marketplace, where they serve all types of seasonal salad entrees and other small plates. These small entrees are $3 per portion.  I LOVE the watermelon radish because I can't get that anywhere else. You can then move to the Land & Sea or Hot Dishes section after the Marketplace. I usually opt out of the Hot Dishes. My go to is always the Tuna Poke because I feel like I get the best deal for my money. The Seared Ahi Tuna is also really good but I'm not sure if 4 or 5 slices is worth the $7. 

And before you leave the place, remember to get a cup of Lemonade! My favorite part about this place is actually their lemonades ( the best one is the Blood Orange!). As you can see, it's easy to rack up a large bill here if you get 2 items at the Marketplace, 1 item at the Land & Sea and a Lemonade. The quality of the food is pretty good and healthy but I always feel like I can get a more filling meal somewhere else. Another reason why Lemonade lost a star is how messy the lines can be sometimes. Everyone doesn't know where to go and is all over the place (maybe it's a little bit better now). Also, the Marketplace allows people to sample the dishes so it takes FOREVER AND A DAY sometimes. Like people, come on, move it ......

TIP: If you want a sandwich, you can skip the line to the Marketplace and go straight to the sandwich section! 

Overall, it's a good lunch spot to hang out as there's a huge patio (but almost impossible to find a space to sit) but maybe not an everyday place. Treat yourself once a while for some lemonade at Lemonade!
author: Tram N.

description: I really like this concept!  A relatively gourmet cafeteria with some healthy options.  I got the ahi tuna and butternut squash.  I admit this is an odd combo, but they both looked good and I was right!  I'd totally order both of them again.  I wasn't sure how big the portions were, I was still a little hungry.  I could have easily eaten an additional item. I'll be back!
author: Chloe M.

description:
CATERING: Sooo disappointing!

The Bad:
1. the kale & kumquat salad "platter" came in what looked like an individual salad. 

I called to let them know about the kale salad and they said it was 10 servings "because it's shredded kale; it's really dense." and that when I ordered catering they should've warned me. Okay, that really would've been one entree salad: 8" x 5" container, it was less than 2" square per serving. 

2. poor customer service
So then I called the catering line to lodge a complaint on the size (nothing about that mentioned on their site or when I ordered) & they said they'd have the store replace it with another [reasonably sized] salad platter. Nothing happened from there. 

3. the Pacific Rim salad comes without dressing and isn't good without dressing and looked kinda old and warn (the celery was browned)
(for once the salad was not all eaten, and because of #1 we had way less servings than we had people.)

4. all of that for a high price point

The Good: (why they get 2 stars instead of 1)
1. sandwiches are delicious
2. "cheesecake" is not really cheesecake, more like an insanely rich pudding with crumbled cookies for crust, and it's insanely good. 

So, if you know:  exactly what to get, what the serving size is, and don't mind paying a good amount you could survive. Otherwise they'll make you look like a miserly a**hole and leave people hungry :(
author: Lady A.

description:
Where do you go? Where do you start? Where's the beginning of the line? It all seemed pretty chaotic inside and the staff doesn't seem to be aware (or care) about all the stressful looks and confusion going on inside. 

Honestly, I came by for a lemonade. It's not something I would normally get but I was heavily pregnant when I first saw someone with one and I recalled how refreshing it would have been as it was a warm day out. I must have had some pretty strong willpower then as I didn't end up getting one (was avoiding overindulging on sugar and carbs at the time) but I vowed to return postnatal. I kept my word and when we were in the area months later, I remembered it and the intense craving of the sweet tartness flooded back in full force. 

Lemonade offers a decent selection of hot and cold choices consisting ranging from healthy to not so healthy options. Food was good enough for lunch break with coworkers or if your dining options are bleak. In fact, I wouldn't mind having this as an option nearby my office. There was a convention happening at Moscone and it seemed many of them  headed here. 

I'd probably only return when my next lemonade (which probably occurs once every other year) cravings strike.
author: Esther A.

description:
Lunch in SOMA in SF can seem like a race. People rush out of their respective offices to the nearby fast casual options, all hoping to beet the inevitable lunch rush. Lemonade is one of the newer options and is already very popular. 

I was pleasantly surprised to find that Lemonade from LA had popped up near my office in SF. We came by early for lunch and there was already a line wrapping around the corner at 11:45am. A staff member tried to explain the concept, which honestly seemed to slow things down. 

I orederd things that I remember liking in LA: the broccoli salad, the avocado with cherry tomatoes, and tried a few new things including the green beans. There are so many choices that it's hard not to be overwhelmed. The green beans were terrible and everything else was just ok. The lemonade options were all full of sugar, which was disappointing as I usually get the sugarless lemonade at the LA locations. Food is fresh and they have a huge variety. Once they get their line moving, this is sure to be a solid lunch option for people nearby. I don't think I'd return as we have one in LA that I prefer.
author: Brittany F.

description:
I came here at least 10 times for to go in the last half year.  The food tasted fresh and usually the line was pretty fast.

Today I came here to buy dinner to go.  There were no people working behind the counter when I arrived so I was just waiting there for several min.  Later a group of people also showed up.  A girl with heavy make up came out to behind the counter and immediately greeted the customer standing behind me.  Apparently she tried very hard to flirt with that guy.  I just said I was here first.  She suddenly stopped smiling then asked me what did I want.  The whole time she was taking my food orders, she looked angry.

I noticed there were many new people working there over time.  The owner should provide some customers training?
author: Jon W.

description: I really like the concept of the place and how everything is pretty healthy. However, I think it tastes better than it looks. I ordered the corn and squash and the Brussel sprouts from the marketplace section and the curry chicken from the land & sea. Everything was a little salty to me and everything tasted super healthy, which isn't what I'm really used to. I also tried the cucumber mint lemonade and the seasonal watermelon lemonade as well, both were pretty good! I also tried the pistachio macaron, it was huge! The biggest macaron I've ever tasted. It was pretty good, a little on the sweeter side but I really liked it's chewy texture. I will probably come back and try other things on the menu and try the other flavors of lemonade as well. Hopefully I'll choose some better tasting entrees and sides next time!
author: Bailey L.

description: Great poke bowl! For $12 that was a good deal of tuna. Good Hawaiian flavor and the sticky rice went pretty well with all the toppings.
author: Dex Y.

description: Pretty solid spot for lunch. I'm big fan of the cucumber mint lemonade. They usually have a bunch of veggie options a la carte. The tomato mozerella with pesto and basil really hits the spot. Overall a pretty safe bet if you're not sure what you're in the mood for, but don't want something too heavy. Bottom line: a little expensive, but a pretty safe bet in terms of quality of food and service.
author: Shubh J.

description: This place has so much potential and love that they offer a variety of menu selections to please all palates, but falls short of execution. I came for a second try thinking maybe my first attempt was just a bad day in their kitchen. Got my kid a mac and cheese which tasted like they made it from scratch. He ate about half a cup. Poke bowl looked pretty good in the picture, and the poke in the food display looked pretty fresh so I ordered myself the spicy poke bowl. Presentation: four star, price for amount of poke you get: two star, taste: one star. The basic ingredient that compliments the poke is  nice fluffy rice. How can you mess something this simple? The rice was hard, under cooked and chewy as if I was eating brown rice. At first I thought it was the crunchy garlic, but ate a few of the rice grains and confirmed undercooked rice. The poke isn't bad, but lacks flavor and a spicy kick. With bad rice, it's hard to enjoy everything else. There's a reason Japanese master the art of rice.  The blood orange lemonade was great at first, but got watered down so fast that it was as if I was drinking flavored water. Sadly I don't think I will be back again.
author: Janice W.

description:
When they finally opened a Lemonade up in the Bay Area, I was beyond thrilled. I honestly made it a point to stop by Lemonade and pick up a drink whenever I was in SoCal. Now that there a few locations here in the Bay Area, I am ecstatic.

My absolute favorite lemonade has been their Cucumber Mint Limeade.  Extremely refreshing, light, and not too sweet like their other flavors. The Blueberry Mint Lemonade is also worth mentioning too. The subtle mint flavor really compliments the blueberry. I have also tried their Guava limeade and to be  honest, I'm not much of a fan simply because it's way too sour.

As for food, there are so many options! Usually I always settle for their popular combination of 2 Marketplace items and a Land Sea entree. My personal favorites have been the Pineapple Chicken and New Mexican Roasted Butternut Squash. The Pineapple Chicken is reminiscent of a healthier version Kung Pao Chicken dish which has the tangy flavor from their dressing yet sweet from the pineapple. The toasted coconut also gives it the perfect crunch. The New Mexican Roasted Butternut is my favorite mainly because it's good and second because I love corn.

As for Land and Sea, you can never go wrong with their Avocado Salmon Louie or Roasted Chicken. Both are hearty enough to keep you full for at least a couple hours.

When you get the chance, you need to also try their Hot Dishes. Their braises are so juicy and tender. The rotisserie chicken is delicious as well and full of flavor. Oh and their white truffle Mac 'N Cheese is to die for! I don't know how they make it but with every bite, the cheese just melts in your mouth.

Downside, Lemonade may seem a little pricey especially for the portions they serve, but hey being healthy ain't cheap.
author: Denzell S.

description:
Fresh healthy and delicious...as well as causal and fast....5* obviously.

Went here with a couple of work friends recently as loved it! You get to choose from an array of salads, hot food, sandwiches and juices all reasonable priced and super fresh. I went for the edamame salad, a carrot salad and the seared tuna. All amazing. Washed down with a guava lemonade....also amazing.

Can this place please be magically shipped over to the U.K now!!!!!! Thanks x
author: Daniel G.

description:
As a longtime fan of Lemonade in LA, I'm so glad they finally have a SF location. Lemonade is a cafeteria format restaurant with so many colorful healthier food options. Ordering can be a little confusing, and over ordering is almost inevitable as you move down the line.

For a quick snack, I usually order two side portions from the first station. The watermelon radish ahi tuna is one of my favorites, followed by the edamame salad or the avocado with cherry tomato salad. If I'm super hungry, I may order three side portions and a protein. One of my favorite protein entrees is the salmon salad served in the halved avocado. Combined with a lemonade, that can quickly add up to become a pretty pricy lunch.

Definitely an awesome addition to the Metreon and a lighter lunch or dinner option if you're trying to ween off of Super Duper Burger (which I eternally crave) next door.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
I'm not sure they provide any sort of training to their employees.. You walk in and everyone including the employees are just standing around not knowing what to do. 

I asked three different questions.. Is there dairy in that dish? What do you sweeten your lemonade with? And are your to-go containers recyclable? The response to every single question was "I don't know". The name of the restaurant is Lemonade and they don't know what their lemonade is made out of. 

Food was very bland and the poke had a bunch of orange seeds in it. 

This place and the food is not worth the hassle.
author: Alanna L.

description:
I wanted to try something new and heard great things about Lemonade. I chose the meal that included a choice of fish and two marketplace salads.  The line seemed a bit slow for food that has already been made, especially when it was 2 (past lunch rush). I picked the peach ginger lemonade, since you know - when in Rome. The meal was slightly higher than what I'd like, but it's not like the prices weren't in front of you when you order. I think with the meal and drink with tax, it's a bit much. 

The peach ginger lemonade was all ginger. Not at all lemony, and not at all peachy. The fish was cold by the time I got to my table, but the two salads I picked were tasty. I really wanted to like Lemonade, but I'll prob never come back
author: Lisa X.

description:
It feels more pricy than the ones in LA. Either that or it's been a while.

Lots of variety and everything looks yummy. Enjoyed their cavatelli pasta, their green beans and broccoli. The smoked salmon was incredibly salty and left me parched. I realized towards the end of my 4 item box that everything was creamy and cheesy. Washed it down w/ a bold orange lemonade that didn't taste like blood orange. 

Super nice and friendly young staff. Parking garage half a block away. Indoor and outdoor seating available.
author: Julie L.

description:
Thank you Chris for your fast and friendly service! 

I got the original lemonade and the guava lime lemonade. If you're planning to just get a drink here, you don't have to wait in the food line. Just go to the registers and the people at the front will help you out. 

The lemonade was good but super sour than I expected. I guess that's what lemonade is suppose to taste like haha. 

Guava lime lemonade was better. I like the hint of guava that was in there but I kind of wished there was more. Like the original lemonade, they are more sour than sweet. But its still yummy (:

Next time I will try a different flavor. I think there was like a mint cucumber flavor I wanted to try. Until next time lemonade! 

TL:DR 
Fun flavors of lemonade. Sour. And refreshing.
author: Stefanie W.

description:
Most of the food is healthy and tastes good. Plus there's a lot of interesting flavor combinations going on, like their signature watermelon radish salad with Ahi tuna.

So why not 4 stars? Because it's so goddamn overpriced, it makes me sad :( You're looking at a $15 meal for one: One hot dish served in a small cup, with two sides of salads. It's a good thing I wasn't very hungry when I went, or else I would've walked out super cranky and still hungry. But at least it tastes good.

With so many affordable options in the area, you could get better value elsewhere. But if the healthy meal is worth the premium for you and/or you have deep pockets, Lemonade will be your fave.
author: Sara L.

description:
Oh Lemonade, if you're reading this please pack up your stuff and board the next plane to Belfast because we could do with you!

Love the concept of this place - healthy food, quick! In a world of Fast Food that's generally pretty bad for you this place provides a welcome break.

One thing to note is the queue moves pretty slowly, especially at lunch but it's worth the wait. I went for two salad items (BLT and Pinaeapple Chicken) along with some Mac and cheese. All this only set me back $16 - good for San Fran!

On a sunny day it's nice to sit out on the terrace but you'll have to be quick to get a spot! One of the best lunches I had in San Fran - try the original lemonade!
author: Stevie M.

description:
Lemonade is somewhat reminiscent of my college cafeteria days, but the quality of food as well as the price point are both much higher. I ordered the roasted brussels sprouts, which were beautifully caramelized, mildly sweet, and cooked to the perfect tenderness. The cheesy ricotta broccoli also made it onto my plate, also delicious. Lastly I had some mandarin quinoa salad which was good as well.

Overall everything was very solid, but the portions are way too small. It was around $12 for three vegetarian options and each of them could be contained in the small ice cream cups (maybe a like it size at Coldstone). I would definitely visit again, but maybe when I feel more like splurging on a health  meal.
author: Tiffany K.

description: The poke bowl was really disappointing at $13, it's 75% white rice and you can't make any substitutions. The original tuna has oranges which unnecessarily fill up the one scoop of tuna that comes with the bowl. They have a wide range of veggies, you might be better off getting some of the other bowls or going a la carte and creating your own.
author: Vasu S.

description:
This lunch place came highly recommended but it was just not for me - I think I ordered badly, to be fair. 

So there's a queuing system which could be confusing - the guy working was really helpful and explained we could jump the queue if we wanted to get sandwiches. Seeing as I'd never been before, I was happy to start from the start and check out the salads and stuff which looked really good. I got a small portion of edamame and a buttermilk chicken sandwich and a lemonade (seeing as that's what they specialise in) and took a seat outside. This whole process felt really slow - like at least 10 minutes, which was a bit longer than I'd have liked. 

Then I had another wait for my food to arrive - possibly another 10 minutes, and when it arrived it looked really bad - squished and the buttermilk coating was soft rather than crisp. I think it mustn't have been cooked fresh even though the wait suggested it was. And yeh, the taste wasn't any better. 

I have to say, my workmates food was a lot better than mine so maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. The mac was lovely and the salads all seemed really good. Would I go back though? Nope, too expensive and too disappointing when there's so many good food options for lunch in the area.
author: Briony C.

description:
I really love this place. Being pregnant, it gave me the right amount of variety that I needed. I have been to the one in Venice and this one is slightly different. I am sad that La Boulange is no longer there, but the staff here is super nice.

Definitely make sure you try out some of the entree's and don't get too much of anything. Its great to have bits of all. Most of all don't leave without trying at least one of the lemonade's. Happy its here, because I can count on it when I'm in SF for work, which is often.

See you soon Lemonade.
author: Ronjini M.

description:
I was walking to Metreon to catch a movie when I saw Lemonade. I happened to be thirsty, and lemonade sounded appealing. And if their NAME is lemonade, they must have amazing lemonade, right?! I walked in.

I've never seen such a spread of lemonade flavors! There were so many, and I wanted to try them all! There was old fashioned lemonade, pomegranate tarragon, coconut apple & kaffir lime, cucumber mint, blood orange, and watermelon rosemary. Even though they're really nice about giving you samples when you ask for them, I felt bad asking for more than three, so I limited my samples to the pomegranate tarragon, blood orange, and watermelon rosemary lemonades.  The tarragon in the pomegranate tarragon was a little too weird for me, but the blood orange and watermelon rosemary were both delicious! I had a hard time deciding which to get, but ended up opting for the blood orange because the watermelon flavor in the watermelon rosemary is so strong that it nearly covers the lemonade flavor, which is what I was feelin. 

The blood orange lemonade was quite good- not too sweet, and very refreshing. Quite pricey though - it came out to $3.93. From other reviews, it sounds like the food can get real pricey as well, but the offerings looked pretty fresh/yummy, so I would come back to try the food sometime. Three stars for now.
author: Josephine L.

description: Very good lemonade! The food looked just as good. We tried the Mac and cheese. Very good!
author: Donovan G.

description:
When I think of the word lemonade, I think of freshness and summer.  Maybe that's one reason why I instantly gravitated towards Lemonade after reading their reviews, plus the fact that it's a healthy option nearby in a sea of fast food options and boringness.  

I needed something quick and easy for dinner and I wanted to be healthy.  The concept seems a little overwhelming at first, and there was no brief explanation or pricing at the front.  Then one of the employees explained to me the pricing when I said it was my first time and I was a little confused on how it works.  Like others said, it definitely does add up!  I ended up eating there but got to go because I wanted to give some to my husband.

A lot of the options looked good indeed albeit some not healthy like truffle Mac n cheese.  I ended up getting two "marketplace" items, being cold meatless salad like options.  Tough choice but I went with the asparagus and cherry tomato salad, couscous with mushroom, and the poke.  Portions aren't like 10 course Michelin rated small, but they are a little on the smaller side for the area.  The poke seemed like a bit more even priced for the quantity.  Total cost after tax was $14.  Some of the asparagus was hard, so they definitely weren't cooked long enough.  The mushroom couscous was lightly seasoned and enjoyable.  On first glance of the poke, it didn't look seasoned at all since I just would clearly see the pink fish flesh, but it had some sesame oil and what made it so spicy were the slices of jalapeño.  I would have liked a bit more of a sauce/marinade for the poke.  No other issues with the preparation or freshness of the fish.  It was around 6:15 or so on a Wednesday and lots of their seating was taken up so I plopped down on one of the last indoor booths which was meant for a minimum of 2, but could easily fit 4-6.  

I'd give Lemonade a chance, but definitely be more mindful of what I'd order.  The delicious looking desserts and sandwiches seem to be a better value.  I just think the quality, portions and taste aren't all quite there for the price.  Like Yelp's own Jessica T. said, it has so much potential, but why so costly when the items aren't organic?
author: Cat C.

description:
I love the concept, although this isn't anything new. Upscale, farm fresh food cafeteria style seems to be the new wave of casual eating. However, Lemonade doesn't quite live up to the fan fare. It was confusing, it was hectic, it was unorganized, but it was tasty and staff were extremely nice, if not also frazzled.

Three sections: cold food, hot food, sandwiches. People were jumping ahead to then realize they wanted hot food and then cutting the line. It was crazed. Nothing was really marked clearly with ingredients listed, making it even more cumbersome since one then needs to wait to ask the attendant serving up the food. Items range from salmon, to chicken, to short rib, to sandwiches and so on. Not much customizing, but some solid choices. 

I opted for some chicken chili, a garden salad and chicken salad. Nice little scoops of each, but nothing crazy for the $12ish price tag. I also went with the cookie and the cucumber lemonade, with the lemonade really being the star of the show. Plenty of seating outside, and this place is in Yerba Buena, so a whole park to enjoy the fare.

Not quite my cup of tea. Maybe with more space and less people, this spot would be more approachable, but downtown San Francisco with a lunch crowd makes this more trouble than it's worth.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Ugh not super impressed. I've been to Lemonade's before but I usually only get their drinks. Had their breakfast once, but this was my first time trying their actual food. My biggest issue was the portion sizes. Everything comes in separate small containers. They can't combine rice and chicken curry, for example, into a single larger container. That was kind of annoying. And for the amount of food that you get, the price ain't that great. I paid $7.95 for a super small cup of their chicken/olive dish. And paid extra for a side of rice. It was good but not that good. Chicken was super tender, the sauce and seasoning they used were great, but the olives made the whole thing a bit too sour, in my opinion. The basmati rice wasn't great either. You don't get a whole lot, and it didn't seem like it was fully cooked. 

Meh. I feel like there are better options around this plaza. Didn't get the lemonade from here this time but that probably would have been the standout.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
My Original Review (1 star)  I really wanted to like this place....the food is okay but the service is awful...waited 40 mins for 2 cold sandwiches. When i asked the waiter if it was usual to wait 45 odd mins for food, he just grinned and walked away.

Update: I was contacted by Fouad within the hour of posting this review. It's clear that customer service is important at Lemonade and I realize we all have our off days, I mean who doesn't? 

I'm sure to visit this place again soon, as I really loved the range of lemonade flavor's they have here.
author: Suhail M.

description:
So excited when I heard Lemonade was coming to the bay area! There are several locations now in the bay area... and soon, the Burlingame location will also be opening soon! Closer to me!  :)

The food is SO fresh and tasty! I love their market salads. You can sample the food as well! They offer a variety of salads, sandwiches, hot/cold dishes, and desserts. The truffle mac and cheese is also a really popular item. You can do a combo set. 

And obviously, you can't leave Lemonade without getting their LEMONADE! :O They have a variety of lemonade... cucumber mint, guava, blood-orange, classic lemonade, and more! Really refreshing on a hot day!

Service was quick and friendly ! This place can be quite pricy.. but it's nice to have this every now and then. 

It's nicely located at the Yerba Buena gardens. You can take a stroll around the area after. Can't wait to try more of their food!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
$17 for a too sour lemonade + small portion of mashed potatoes (very good though) + disgustedly over spiced chicken.

La Boulange was a way better deal.
author: Jr P.

description:
Lemonade has potential - but unfortunately their current set-up hinders their ordering efficiency. Be prepared to stand in a line that is just as confused as you are - as to how to order their meal choices.

As far as healthy options and variety - Lemonade is on point.They have a diverse selection of unique salads, vegetables, and both hot and cold meat and vegetarian entree options.  I thoroughly enjoyed my meal options the other day, which included:

1.) avocado and tomato salad,
2.) watermelon radish and ahi tuna salad
3.) a well seasoned slab of salmon

The price is another issue though. Sides add up quickly here and while I enjoyed my selections - the food is not organic and it's hard for me to rationalize paying such a high price on a regular basis.

If you're trying to entertain a big group or just want some healthier fare - Lemonade is a good fit - but I recommend familiarizing yourself with their menu beforehand and paying close attention to how much food you're ordering - since you may be surprised once you reach the cash register.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
"Tell him boy, bye." (from Beyonce's "Lemonade" visual album)

That's how I feel about my first time at Lemonade.

My big pet peeve is when restaurants don't honor the menu or pricing they have posted online. I checked Lemonade's summer menu for the Yerba Buena Gardens location moments before entering and decided to order the $12.85 combo (2 Marketplace + 1 Land & Sea, including dessert and lemonade). This price is posted prominently here: http://www.lemonadela.com/viewer.html?file=http://z.lmnd3.com/2016/06/16/15/24/07/527/2.0_Summer16_SFMenu_trifoldWEB.pdf.

However, when I went to go check out, the cashier rung me up for $18+. I was like "HOLD UP, this is the pricing I see on the menu" and I spoke to two other people before the manager came over to confirm that "they just changed the menu" and weren't offering that price. They asked me if I was looking at a coupon or something but no, it was literally their menu. Posted online. 

So a tiny, sad cup of poke and 2 small servings of sides came out to $13.89. An additional lemonade with tax would be more than $18. I said no to the lemonade because I wasn't about to drop that much money on a lunch.

Anyway, moral of the story is that they should have acknowledged and apologized for the price difference, especially because it was pretty steep. Secondly, don't make me feel stupid or cheap for quoting a price that you have on your website.

BOY, BYE.
author: Valerie L.

description:
I think I need to give this spot another chance. Don't get me wrong, I totally dig Lemonade's healthy fast casual concept. I like the variety of salads, small plates, sandwiches, and protein items. And I like that everything is in the $10-$12 price range. But something just feels off.

I guess it all starts with the ordering process. The restaurant has a cafeteria-style set-up. They give you a tray; you choose the items you want; they give you a number; and then you pay. Sounds pretty simple, right? And yet it wasn't. Upon entry, we were handed a menu (which sort of contradicts the idea of a pick & choose cafeteria set-up). And even more bizarre, the menu doesn't really tell you anything other than the combo/pricing options. For example, you can order a Land & Sea combo, or a Sandwich & Salad combo. Or, you can go straight to the hot bar (and completely bypass everyone in the other lines). Everyone in line just looked perplexed by the whole ordering system. One person opted to go straight to the sandwich counter, and someone accused her of cutting the line. They definitely need a better traffic-control system.

By the time I finally arrived at the food counter, I was just overwhelmed by all the food options. I wound up ordering a combo deal (poached salmon with 2 sides) for $12.95. The sides I got were the sobu noodles/veggies with peanut sauce, and the ahi tuna/veggie medley. The salmon was quite good and a generous portion. The sobu noodles were a nice starch to pair with my protein. However, the ahi tuna/veggie medley was quite bland.

While waiting in line, I happened to pass by the hot bar. The nice chef working the counter offered me a taste of their braised short rib. Wow - that dish packed quite a flavorful punch. I think next time I might forego all the healthy stuff and beeline straight to the hot bar for some unhealthy meat, mac & cheese, and other carby-goodness.

On the plus side, all the employees were super friendly and accommodating even while they were getting bum-rushed. Also, there's plenty of sunny outdoor seating. And for the most part, the food is quite tasty and fresh. But waiting in line for food here is a bit complicated. I don't like feeling stressed out on my lunch break. So I'm going to wait a few months until they work out some kinks, and then I'll be back.
author: Kevin B.

description: I usually come here for dinner.  They don't have a lot of indoor seating but they do have plenty of outdoor seating under a heated lamp and patio covering.  The food can be a little bit on the salty / sauced up side, but they have very creative dishes with ample flavor and ingredients.  The sides are usually cold as are some of the meats.  My go-tos are the broccoli cheese, the fig salad, and ahi tuna.  This combo is usually enough for a meal.  I haven't hated anything that I've tried here.  So I think it's mostly up to personal taste as to which sides to get.  A little bit on the pricey side for the small serving sizes, but always a savory meal!
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Coming from Southern California, I'd typically rave about Lemonade. It's a SoCal staple and what many probably imagine as "California food" - light, healthy, fresh. But oh my, the Lemonade in SF just falls flat every time I have hopes for it (not even necessarily high ones...but still, holding onto hope). 

The portions here are shockingly tiny. So tiny, that there have been numerous times in which I and other guests have eyed each other, thinking, "Is this right?" In fact, once, it bugged a lady and me so much that after she finished her meal, she walked up to me and said how yeah, two scoops used to be enough here, but now they're really skimping. Needless to say, we walked off in disappointment. And I honestly think some of the workers feel awkward with how little they're allowed to scoop (although I believe some of them are more generous than others).

It's like, skimping so much it's almost embarrassing, and you feel like you're being deprived and internally ridiculously begging for more. And it's not like you're paying a small amount. A full meal will cost at least $14. It adds up real quick. 

Also, almost every. single. time I come here, there's a group of people who don't understand the concept of Lemonade (wait at stations - you don't have to go through all of them, and let the attendant know what you'd like), and really really drags the already slow process here to be even slower. It does sure make me miss SoCal, where people are on top of how it works~!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I know I'm a little late, but IT'S HERE!!!

Lemonade was one of the major reasons why I LOVED being a student at USC, and a major reason why I was SO SAD to be moving back to the bay after graduation. I ate it almost every single day for lunch. Lunches at Lemonade can easily rack up to $20... so I pretty much spent all of my hard-earned internship moolah on Israeli couscous and seared ahi tuna. Now THAT is true love.

ANYWAY... LEMONADE LA IS NOW (also) LEMONADE SF. AND THAT'S ALL THAT MATTERS.

I actually haven't been to this location yet, but I've just placed an order via Postmates and I'm 110% sure it will meet my expectations. I'm so confident, that I'm writing this review before I've even had it.

I'm so HAPPY!

P.S. My favorite lemonade is the watermelon one... which they do not have here?!
author: Jennifer K.

description: To be honest, I am not really a lemonade fan so I don't really have anything to compare this place to. Since I am a big fan of orange juice though, I was more than happy to try the blood orange lemonade they serve here. The service was very quick and the venue was surprisingly pretty packed with a lot of people eating. I enjoyed my drink but I do wish they had a smaller size as well as the standard size, since I found it really hard to finish my entire drink by myself. The location here is also very nicely located in Yerba Buena gardens, so it is a very convenient place to visit whether you're on an afternoon stroll or tired from the mall.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Lemonade was one of my favorite spot but their service getting worse. You pay $14 + tax for the two cold salads and one small Salmon and their hand is shaking to give you what you paid for just like Panda Express.. the amount is getting very small and if you don't ask the crispy bread they are not give to you.. always new employees and they asked you when they know you are not happy but they are talking and laughing at you... smh

No more Lemonade.
author: Gize A.

description:
Anxiously anticipating the arrival of LA's Lemonade in the Bay Area, I made sure to stay tuned to their social media channels for opening information. I made it up to this location at Yerba Buena a few weeks after opening.

The staff is quite friendly (especially compared to some of the LA locations!), and a greeter at the door helps explain the ordering process. I still think the layout (especially in small space at YB) is quite confusing and chaotic at times. Many customers unknowingly cut lines for specific items, and it can take quite long to pay for your meal.

The "Marketplace" dishes are better here than they are at many of the LA locations! They are definitely expensive, but all of the veggies are fresh and delicious. My current favorites include the Kumquat Kale Salad and the Panzanella Salad, and the Roasted Carrots. Salads are always tasty too, and dressing can mixed in or served on the side. 

By far my favorite cold meat dish is the Curry Chicken!! It is quite rich, but the sliced apple, golden raisins, and mayo/curry sauce on the chicken work quite well together!

Lemonade beverages are tasty, but nothing special in my book. Many of them are overly sweet!

I'm looking forward to returning soon and trying some of the hot entrees and desserts at this specific location soon!
author: Jackson L.

description:
Great choices
Healthy options
Warm and chilled items like soups, salads, proteins, grains, etc.
Tasty
Great lemonade and desserts 
The cucumber mint lemonade is very refreshing
Salmon was a great value and was delicious 
Had the kale salad added salmon--enough leftover for dinner
author: B W.

description: Not very nice staff. Everybody acts like it's their first day. Everybody walks around confused as to what they are doing. Staff are rude and inconsiderate.
author: Alejandro C.

description: They basically have a variety of pre-made options and you select a few. They do have a lot of unique salads and a lot of vegetarian options. The lines are ridiculous; but I don't think it's because there are a lot of people ordering, I think it's just poorly organized. The food isn't bad, but it's also not amazing, it's fairly mediocre. The portions are also kind of small for the price. Overall, it's not that bad, but there are many better options in the vicinity.
author: Keerthi N.

description:
I came here with some high expectations for the lemonade since everyone has been raving about it and I was definitely not disappointed. I came during lunch time on Thursday and it was busy but we were still able to quickly get our food. 

The salads were delicious! Grabbing 4 of their small salads at $2.95 each you can have a variety of flavors and choices and they all were very fresh and tasted great. We had the New Mexican Roasted Butternut Squash, Kale and Kumquat, Wild Arugula and Asian Pears and the Watermelon Radish and Ahi Tuna. They all were very well seasoned and good portion sized for its price. Only thing was the Watermelon Radish and Ahi Tuna I wish had more tuna because I had only two pieces in it and it was much less seasoned than the rest so I barely tasted it. However, they all were fresh and filling.

While I was very tempted to try more things we said next time we come we will! The lemonades itself: we ended up getting the Blood Orange lemonade and the Guava limeade and I liked both. I can see why the Blood Orange lemonade is its best seller with its sweetness without being overly sweet. The Guava limeade is tart and I love tart so for me it worked out great but if you aren't a fan watch out because it does get very acidic as you keep drinking. 

Overall it was great and the staff were nice, patient, and really friendly. If you are eating there, it is kind of a feat to find seating while the staff are quick to clean up and get rid of peoples plates, so many people come that you need to just hope that people leave as quickly as people are being seated.
author: Angela S.

description:
One of my favorite lunchtime spots in/around FiDi area.

You can get a seasonal salad for $6 and a salmon fillet for $7, making it a spot to get a healthy, yummy, cost-effective bite. But then beware... the macaroons are as huge as they are delicious.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
You know, I was SO stoked for a lemonade to open up. I'm originally from LA so to have a little piece of home be up here, got me so excited. UNFORTUNATELY, there were some huge problems that I didn't catch until afterwards. 

1. 25 minute wait time for my food.
2. Overcharged me, individually charged my orders instead of making combos. And charged me for a sandwich I never received 
3. Ordered a sandwich and it never came out after the 25 minute wait. 

I probably should have waited a bit longer for the sandwich, double checked my orders, spoke up about the receipt, but I was getting a bit angsty. And I'm usually a pretty patient person. I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon until the system gets better.
author: Tiffany J.

description: This place is legit. I was craving a good sandwich and salad and this sure hit the spot. I tried the Orecchiette Pasta & Cherry Tomatoes along with the BLT Panzanella Salad from the Marketplace and both were delish. I also got the Herb Roasted Chicken Sandwich which was good both rather plain. The guava lemonade was unique and tart which I enjoyed. When I went they had samples of the Raspberry Macaroons at the register and they were literally the best I have ever had. I can't wait to try more salads, sandwiches and lemonade from their menu. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the city.
author: Ali M.

description:
Woohoo! I was hella stoked when I saw that Lemonade was opening up in SF. Finally a little piece of LA goodie right at home. 

I was excited to see that the dishes and quality are exactly as I remembered from LA, but of course with SF-style wait time. I waited about 25 minutes to get to the food bar to choose my food. Even though I've been to Lemonade before, I thought it would've been helpful for the servers to explain the ordering process again. All the food and line made the process super overwhelming and I felt like I ended up ordering really random things. 

I got the curry cauliflower, tuna in an avocado and a blood orange lemonade. The cauliflower was delicious but the curry was too strong for me to finish. The tuna avocado was good though! Of course the lemonade was on point, but sipping icy lemonade doesn't quite have the same effect in chilly SF. 

I think the service will probably improve with time and I'll likely be back soon!
author: Tiffany U.

description: Eating here is usually a mildly irritating experience due to the physical layout and resulting confusion and poor line management. Also takes a pretty long time to get your food if you order a sandwich combo. I don't know why they don't give you the salad right away since they've already plated it, but they make you wait 15 minutes for it to come out with the sandwich. As others have mentioned, it seems like the food quality has declined a bit since they opened. I come here because it's close to work, but it doesn't seem like a very good value.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: Honestly the food was ok but the lady at the register, SELINA Z. Was very rude and gave me and the rest of my party dirty looks. I don't know who pissed in her Cheerios. Everyone else was ok though, Selina is the only reason why I'm giving her a bad review. And another person behind the counter who was irritated that we were looking and weren't ready to order yet. They need to stress customer service more when they train their employees.
author: Jessie C.

description:
I've been here twice and both times I got the yellow wax beans and pickled asparagus and red miso beef. The beans were crunchy and not overcooked and the cheese was very light but added a nice creaminess. The miso beef was very flavorful and tender, and the sauce was slightly sweet. 

The truflle mac and cheese was good too. The truffle flavor was very strong. The guava limade was too tart for my liking. The cucumber mint lemonade was very refreshing, and the mint added a nice touch. The brussel sprouts were a bit too soft, I like them more fried than sauteed. 

I'll definitely come back to try more of their items although I think it'll be hard for me to not resort back to getting the yellow wax beans and miso beef again. They're delish!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Call me basic, but I love Lemonade - the drink and the LA chain restaurant. I'm very glad I got to check out the first bay area location in San Francisco before my new job down in Palo Alto. (And I'm double glad the Palo Alto location is opening up soon!)

The concept is simple, it's like a cafeteria: walk down the line, try some samples, and order what food items you'd like. They have seasonal salads, land/sea, sandwiches, and hot foods. You can get a combo of 2 salads + 1 land/sea for $12.95, a combo of sandwich + 1 side salad for $11.95, or 1 full salad + land/sea for $14.75. Every time I dined there, I was full with 2 or 3 signature salads, for $2.95 each. Definitely not making my wallet cry!

- Roasted Cauliflower with golden raisins, almonds, and curry vinaigrette: these are vegetables I can eat forever! The curry was flavorful and not overpowering.
- Israeli Couscous with mushroom, parmesan, and lemon truffle vinaigrette: the couscous was cooked perfectly and filling
- Soba Noodles & Kimchi Vegetables with peanuts and creamy sesame vinaigrette: light and filling
- Orecchiette Pasta & Cherry Tomatoes with mozzarella and chimichurri vinaigrette: big portions (filling because of the pasta) and very juicy cherry tomatoes
- Watermelon Radish & Seared Ahi Tuna with snap peas, ginger, and sesame vinaigrette: this dish was just okay to me - not too much ahi tuna (although big pieces), but lots of snap peas so it was definitely healthy tasting
- Smoked Salmon with watercress, bagel chips, and horseradish dressing: surprisingly, there was a lot of smoked salmon in this dish. Love!
- White Truffle Mac N Cheese ($4.50): apparently, this is the most popular hot dish! It was definitely good, but I didn't think it was the best truffle mac n cheese I've ever had.

A cup of lemonade is $3.50, and they have a couple of flavors for you to choose from. Very refreshing to go with your meal!

They have indoor and outdoor seating, and it's all first come first serve. I love dining outdoors when the weather in San Francisco is nice!
author: Christine S.

description: Came here 1/13. I had the spicy ahi tuna poke bowl with avocado and it was amazingly good, though not spicy at all. Everything tasted fresh and the flavors complimented each other well. As the title says, there are different types of lemonade here, such as blood orange or cucumber mint. Each has their own twist, and it was refreshing that nothing was cloyingly sweet. It was a bit overpriced though - with my poke bowl and standard-sized lemonade my meal was nearly $17. Staff was friendly, place was mostly clean - just beware of pigeons. They fly around the outside seating area and sometimes get inside too. Not necessarily a deal breaker though, but I wish the staff came around more to wipe down tables.
author: Ifeoma U.

description: Lemonade is a trendy lunch spot close to the convention center. The layout is a little confusing and it does feel like it can get really pricey if you don't plan right. It's easy to be full with a reasonable price, but you have to evaluate your options. They do provide paper menus outlining all the food which helps. The Brussels sprouts are out of this world.
author: Nikita S.

description:
I actually really like Lemonade. And this location a lot better than the one in Venice because here the portions are probably almost double the size as of the one in Venice! Made me a happy girl with leftovers.

Anyway, I usually go for 3-4 portions. If it's your first time, it's a cafeteria concept -- point and receive a scoop of food. I think Lemonade makes a great option for lunch time because it's not super greasy and you can have variety. My favorite is the pineapple chicken. It's sooo good! I'm so tempted to buy their next cookbook so I could just make it myself. I think price point is pretty good, and you can just request a different number of portions depending how hungry you are. I did notice however, that portions are 10 cents more than SoCal. Some of their cold dishes also use a lot of avocados!

Also, don't be afraid to ask for samples! The people working there were nice and didn't mind at all. There isn't much seating inside, so when you sit outside, be careful -- the birds fly up so close to you, in hopes of getting fed...
author: Janet H.

description:
The socal chain finally makes it to the bay area.

Who doesn't love a refreshing taste of lemonade? Came here during their grand opening, and it wasn't as busy as I thought it'd be. Maybe it's because I came here right after work, and people would rather catch their BART than stop by. Lemonade was never really my go-to chain in socal, but it's never a bad choice if I do decide to go. 

How it all works is you make your way down the line choosing foods from sections of Marketplace, Leafy Greens, Land & Sea, Sandwiches, and Hot Dishes. At no means do you have to start at the beginning if you just want specific foods from different sections. Lemonade can be ordered at the register.

SERVICE: 
Majority of the workers all exemplified great customer service. The worker who passed around menus to people coming in greeted everyone nicely and explained the menu in a concise manner. Tables were always being cleaned and cleared as soon as customers finished their meals. The people serving food on our plates were super patient and welcoming while allowing everyone to sample as much as they could (marketplace food, hot dishes, and lemonade ...not the land & sea). The cashier neglected to ask if I wanted to sample any lemonade, but it's understandable considering how hectic the line got. My friends and I weren't sure whether or not to leave the trays or dispose of our mess ourselves, so when we attempted to separate our trash in the designated bins, one of the workers politely told us he could handle everything. Overall, this is the best kind of service I've had in a very long time.

FOOD:
-Hawaiian ahi tuna poke: (3/5) I've had better. 
-soba noodles & kimchi: (4/5) A nice mixed dish but not much kimchi to it.
-some Thai chicken/beans (can't find on menu): (4/5) Slightly spicy, but tasty.
-mac & cheese: (4/5) Mac and cheese tasted great! I'd say go for the truffle mac & cheese instead.
-original lemonade: (5/5) As good as lemonade can be.
author: Kevin S.

description: Love the fresh options and the staff is so incredibly friendly. Perfect locations for grab and go or to eat in!
author: Jayme S.

description:
loved this place in so cal, so def had to check it out here. love that you pay per item here so you get to customize your whole order & there are so many options- my fave. 

today I went with the 3 items from marketplace and the total comes out to less than $10 and its a perfect lunch size. I went with an asian theme today got the tuna with watermelon radish, sesame lo mein & pineapple chicken with green beans. the flavors all work so well together ! I will say, I typically get the pineapple chicken & tuna so I love those ! The lo mein was good but a little salty for my taste... next time i'll switch out that side. 

i'll def be back & hopefully the line will be much shorter ... I went at about 12:45 thinking the line would be gone but I waited about 20 minutes for my food.
author: danielle a.

description:
Good food. Intense to get through the line though. They don't have a pre-set menu for many of their items as I'm sure they change so you're pushed through a crowded space in the line with people asking what you want...as you stare through the glass you feel the pressure. Everything looks good, they let you sample, but it's so hard to choose!
I opted for a turkey sandwich which was fantastic. Their sugar-free lemonade was a touch sour for my taste but overall good. I would certainly come back here again as many of their items are healthy and it's a quick grab-n-go place. I can see it getting a touch expensive for ordering several items as it's kind of  buffet/cafeteria style. Everything looked delicious though and there's plenty of options! Do wish they have a few more soups to choose from.
author: Valerie W.

description: Not at all impressed by this location. The only positive is the lovely patio. I came at 6:15 pm on a Monday and there was a long line and it was the slowest service I've ever received. Typically, when you walk into a Lemonade, you feel a sense of upbeat energy and "let's get moving" vibe (in a good way!). Lemonade typically seems to train their staff to know how to keep a line moving quickly and efficiently! Not this Lemonade (and I've been to three - Studio City, Pasadena and Inner Sunset). These employees are sauntering about and have ZERO sense of urgency. I don't typically write reviews based on speed because I a) understand lines and wait times and b) I'm generally a patient person. However, this goes against what I thought was "The Lemonade way." Plus, it is hotter than hades in here and it feels like this warm temperature cannot be good for the food! I love Lemonade, but I will  think twice before visiting this location, again.  So sorry, Lemonade, to judge you on the first visit, but I'm really disappointed!
author: Shelley V.

description:
If you didn't already know, Lemonade is so hawt right now! I've already been here twice in the last week- can't stay away!! I suggest coming here in off-peak hours- the line the first time was waaayyy long. I also think they're working out the kinks in the supply chain, so please be patient with the workers you Salty Sallies out there. It IS the slowness that pulled me down to 4 stars however I know they'll iron it out over time.

Both times I got the Land N Sea combo. After thinking about it, I'd probably just get one protein and one side, as that's a perfect lunch for me. Price was $13 + tax+tip but the portions are substantial and the ingredients are very fresh. I wanted to get the steak w/ chimichurri sauce and asparagus, but they were out :(. Popular items I guess.

The first time I went I had the arugula and blue cheese salad, poached salmon, and soba noodles with cauliflower. I also tried my friend's  butternut squash and it was pretty tasty. The salmon was cooked perfectly and was very good.

Second time I was a little more lukewarm on my choices. I went around 10:45 so avoid the lunch rush and kind of hastily made my decisions. Got the poke, quinoa and apple salad, and greens and salmon salad (I know double fish but the chicken wasn't calling to me). I felt everything was okay. A healthy meal for sure, but nothing to rave about. I probably wouldn't order these things again.

Both times I got the guava limeade and that's my go-to drink! I'm usually a "just water" girl, but with a name like Lemonade I had to try it out. Damn g, this drink is good! If it's not too crazy in there ask for samples of the drinks!

I've not tried the hot food yet but those brussel sprouts have my name on them!!! I'll be here at least once a week- this is a lunch game-changer.
author: Alyssa J.

description: Omg!! This is so gross! I was coming by to have lunch with my friends at Lemonade.  One of my friends recommend me to this place for their good healthy food options and service. But when we arrive there was no place to sit because Someone forgot to clean up the tables.it's disgusting!!!
author: Emilie G.

description: I had a piece of their coconut cake before and it was really good. This time it was hard, dry and very cold. I was hungry so I ate it, but had to go next door and get coffee from Starbucks to wash the taste out of my mouth.
author: Jason P.

description:
Nothing special. 

Overpriced food that gives you small portions, and food is okay. There's nothing special with the food here. The tuna was not good at all, it's not fresh, bristol farms was waaaaaaaaaaay better for tuna poke. And the other stuff, it was okay, some of them were underseasoned. If you wanna eat healthy, you're better off going to super duper and get a salad there. It'll be worth your wallet and you will be satisfied.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: A little pricey but that lemonade is amazing oh my God. You have to try the cucumber mint. I bet it'd taste even better with a splash of gin. The food is also good but the process, if you're new, can be very confusing and if you place your cup of lemonade on the tray it'll fall so be careful. Rookie mistake.
author: Peter B.

description:
I've always loved Lemonade and was excited to find out they were coming up to the Bay Area. This is their first Bay Area location and it's just as good as their SoCal locations. 

Your meal here does add up and can quickly get expensive. I know that their ingredients are high quality but it still feels a bit overpriced.

Lemonade flavors changes often but my faves are blood orange and watermelon rosemary. You can buy refills for $1.96 each.

Service is always great. They are super generous with samples. Just ask!

There is a big parking lot across the street (across from Westfield Center). Prices are not bad. Cheaper than parking at the meter.

I can't wait for them to open in West Portal!
author: Andy W.

description:
2.5 stars. I know Yelp doesn't do halfsies, so I eventually settled on 2 bc I think lemonade is more "meh I've had better" than "a-ok".

First off, THANK YOU to Viet N., who's a true friend bc he was willing to have lunch w me on short notice (a couple hours) and for coming here. Ive really been wanting to try lemonade and knew he didn't care much for it.

I tried pasta + grilled veggies, potatoes and smoked salmon, and the glazed hot chicken. I thought overall the food tasted like mediocre cafeteria food at a high premium. I was also left wanting more from the watermelon Rosemary lemonade. Service was nothing to write home about either.

I left unimpressed and wouldn't recommend lemonade to others. Bummer bc I had been highly looking forward to trying it out!
author: Michelle N.

description: Decent at best, a west coast watered down rip off of Dig Inn, with Medicare food and gimmicks that don't land
author: Jim H.

description:
I really like the idea of Lemonade - fresh and healthy options that you can build into your own lunch (kind of cafeteria style, except the food is way better). Super quick and easy!

Everything here felt fresh and pleasant. I ordered the tomato & avocado salad, pear & wild arugula salad, hawaiian poke, truffle mac & cheese, and a guava limeade. Total came out to about $24, which I felt is a bit steep for lunch.

They price per item, so just look at each option before deciding what you want because it'll stack up quick because everything just looks so good and my eyes are bigger than my stomach. I was not handed a menu or anything (and it was my first time at a Lemonade) so I wasn't familiar with the concept and ended up over ordering.

I hope that they open up a location closer to my workplace to help me stay on track for summer body 2016! ;)
author: Josephine T.

description: Yum! Got take out for the first time tonight and was really impressed. The salmon was moist and delish. Both mac n cheeses were addictive. The ahi and salads were awesome. Highly recommend.
author: Mindy G.

description:
I'm always a fan of Lemonade.  There were plenty in LA and was one of my go to DTLA lunches.  Now we have one in SF!  Yeay!  It can be over priced, but it's trendy and healthy so... that sounds about right.  You can sample whatever you want; my favorite is the Watermelon Radish.  Since it's a little cooler up in here, I opted for the chili and arugula salad.  It was good.  

As for the drinks, the lemonade is always way too sweet for me.  I like/need to get the sugar free option or cut one with some water.
author: Lyn C.

description:
I didn't realize there was SO many choices! I wanted to come check this place out because everything seemed really fun, fresh and healthy. 

Protip: they let you sample everything if you want. Be sure you don't hold up the line though!

I was feeling like I should eat healthy that night and I got the watermelon radish with seared ahi tuna and the sesame marinated lo mein (which I think is vegain). I also got the blueberry lemonade pretty much sampling all the drinks and I thank the guy behind the counter who was so patient with me on that.

Everything was pretty good. It tasted light and had good flavors. But maybe it was too healthy for me or the portion wasn't enough because I got hungry pretty quickly after. It was more like a large snack especially since the was no meat or carbs (so my mistake). 

Overall, if you order all the sides, I feel like it's a bunch of large snacks trying to become a meal. They do have sandwiches and heartier items though so maybe I'll give it another chance.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Um, just took the food out of the bag. My wife WAS  excited to try the avocado salmon Louie BUT... we found a long, light brown hair in the Louie (her hair is black in case you were wondering). Ummm... yeah. Will have to update later while we both collectively gag. *GAG*

---------- 25 minutes later ---------

Okay, so aside from the hair incident, the food tastes fresh and the assortment of "Marketplace" cold items is nice. I like that they allow you to try any of the items before you commit to purchasing a particular item (probably to the chagrin of the persons in line behind you). There are some unique combinations inspired by countries from Asia to the Mediterranean and to the American Southwest.

Their lemonades are pretty good and worth a try. That being said, the hair in the food was really a shocker and therefore I can only give Lemonade 2-stars for now, but may give it another try again down the line.
author: Steve T.

description:
Something about a sunny day triggers my sandwich cravings, so after shopping at Target. I decided to try this place out. Once you walk in, it's sort of confusing, so there is a greeter who immediately says hello and tells you what's what. They hand a menu to you to speed things up. Apparently the lines are shorter on the weekends than weekday. Makes sense due to the FiDi work crowd.

Step 1 - Get in line and decide quickly! 

Step 2 - The menu says you are welcome to sample. They've got a bunch of veggie options. 

Step 3 - Pay, get your number, and stand and wait or find a table. They will bring your order to you. 

Originally I wanted to order vine ripe tomatoes from the Hot Veggies section of menu, but it was unavailable so I quickly decided on cherry tomato+avocado ($2.95) from Vegan section. I also ordered the Gandolfini sandwich ($7.95), which has thin slices of turkey, chicken and ham, thin slice of swiss cheese, and lots of pepperoncini and olives. Fantastic flavors from the pepperoncini and olives. Not sure if they added any dressing but the sandwich drips all over the place; it was a bit much. Luckily the bread is sturdy. I think it was sourdough, but they don't ask what kind of bread you want. 

I could have done without the cherry tomato and avocado. The tomatoes were overripe and not firm and since the avocado has been sitting out, it was mushy. I will stick with the sandwiches and try the other veggies sides on a future visit. AND of course, try a lemonade.  

Overall, fast and very friendly service, reasonable prices, and tasty food!
author: Thomas L.

description: Was in San Francisco for a conference and this was very close to my hotel. Went for lunch and loved all the options I selected. Also, the lemonade was delicious! My only criticism is I wish there were vegetarian options on the hot dishes
author: Taylor L.

description:
Fantastic Fresh and Soooo Tasty! I was a little confused when I walked in, and sad because I miss La Boulange, but there was a nice man there to help me, and told me what I had to do to get food. It's like a buffet but you're charged per item, and there's a salad section, where you get charged per portion (so you could get 4 portions of the same thing or 2 different single portions). There's a helpful stack of boxes to show you how big the portions are. Then you tell the people behind the glass what you'd like and how much. TIP! You can taste anything! It's really similar to going out for ice-cream, but much healthier. Next section is sandwiches followed by hot food. Both of these are served at a steady portion size so they're priced as is, like a cup of chowder is going to be this much. And there's dessert you can grab near the cashier (also individually priced).

This place is a safe haven for vegetarians and meat eaters alike! So many vegetarian options! They're mostly labeled as such but if you're not sure, there's the person who made it just behind the glass! Also great that they don't make it feel like you're separate for eating only vegetarian dishes. 

The food it very tasty! I tried the veggie chili but I wanted it spicier so I stuck to the salads at the front. Let me just say I was not expecting some of the flavor combinations, nor going home with fava beans of all things. 

If anyone is complaining about the price, punch them. They're getting amazing quality food for what they're paying for, and the servers are all honest, friendly, and polite. If you're in a rush come another time, because it's much better to take your time and figure out what you really want. 

If you're confused about the line, don't be. You don't have to stay at the counter waiting for the lunch line to move along, you can get in line to pay for whatever number you were assigned when you started asking for food. It's a little cramped though, so it might be difficult to distinguish the lines, but I have faith that you're all smart people and can figure that bit out.
author: Astrid V.

description: Grabbed dinner here after work and got one of the plates with hot food and a salad. The food was alright and reasonably priced (but not cheap either). Convenient location is a plus. I would have given 3 stars if not for 2 of the workers who were standoffish bordering on rude... not a bad place for a quick bite but I wouldn't seek it out
author: Mino B.

description: I walked in and was greeted in line by a man describing the menu and how the ordering works at Lemonade. I had done my research before, so I came in knowing what I wanted. I knew I could cut in line, so I ordered the turkey BLT sandwich with avocados, arugula, and a pesto aioli sauce. I also ordered the guava limeade. I like that you order first and pay. It's just easier when you go out with friends and don't have worry about splitting the check. I waited approximately 5-10 minutes for my sandwich to come. It was quite big to just eat it fully, so I cut it in half. I took a bite and it was delicious. The arugula was probably my favorite part. Pesto is one of my favorites, so that was just amazing. The guava limeade was a little too tart, but I still enjoyed it. I am planning to come back to try the other foods they have here.
author: Allyson L.

description: Came here on Sunday after a trip to the Moma with my friend. We both had salads with tuna poke and we're both  now suffering from severe food poisoning. Never coming back here.
author: Faye H.

description: Sad to update my review. This place has gone downhill. Nothing is clean, and maybe that's why there's mice by the trash. Couldn't eat me food after seeing that because the trash outside is literally right next to the seats. They don't refill anything you have to wait forever even if there is no one in line and the employees stand around talking to their friends.
author: Emma M.

description: If you're seeking something that is healthy and vegetarian choices, a nice place to get a quick cafeteria style meal.  I'd probably be disappointed if looking for something heavier like a hamburger, pasta, etc.  Everything is a la carte, which was a little confusing at first.  You go through a line and folks behind the counter scoop up what you want from each station.  We shared several things, was perfect for the kind of food we were looking for.
author: Tom S.

description:
One of the newer lunch spots on my rotation. These higher end cafeteria style  places are so hot right now. Not sure if they have an official name, but I like 'em.

Insider 411:
Line gets long but don't be intimidated. It moves quickly. 
People tend to either get the ready made items or a sandwich. I prefer the former and 3 items does the job. 
When crowded, get your item to go and just eat at the park.
author: James B.

description:
Great location facing Yerba Buena Gardens, lots of sunshine in the summertime. BLT was delicious with a pesto spread paired with an ice cold old fashion lemonade. Perfectly toasted bread is much appreciated!

The concept is cool but can get quite chaotic when trying to order during a busy lunch hour.
author: Briget P.

description:
Overall: It was my first time here and it was pretty good.  The food looked fresh and the best of all is that you can try it before ordering (except I didn't try anything, LOL). 

Food: I ordered roasted broccoli, green beans with chicken, and grilled salmon.  Each had its own flavor and taste.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: LOVED the strawberry lemonade and the mashed potatoes. The grilled chicken was bland to me though, and my friends chicken sandwich wasn't that great either. Great location and cute outdoor seating, and it's good for instagram pictures
author: Audra P.

description:
I feel in love with this place when I was in LA a while back so I was super excited when it opened in metreon. It's funny seeing they confused people try to figure out how to order.

I had a movie to rush to see so kept it simple with the Cali flower, Thai chicken, Mac and cheese and stewed chicken.

Everything was excellent as always. If you are looking for a home cooked meal at fast food speed this place cannot be beat. My meal was $20 but I did get four items so in SF that is actually a deal smh.

The only con is that there high traffic location can make finding a seat though but there are a number of options if you get your order to go since Yerba Buena and the metreon did court are adjacent.
author: Corey H.

description: The quality of food was actually a lot better than I had thought.  I was bummed that they were out of the poke bowls. I decided to try the side combo meal. It was really good and tasted fresh. The toast was ok, not great.  The lemonade was fresh squeezed and tasted so good.
author: Marc M.

description: Great addition to the area. They have lots of different dishes to choose from, both hot and cold. A tad expensive for what you get but it's fast and the variety is great. There aren't a lot of healthier food options by the movie theater so this is a nice alternative to go to grab a fast bite.  And you can sit outside right by Yerba Buena which is a nice treat.
author: Dee K.

description: Visiting from Washington DC.  Was walking through the mall and asked a reliable source (pressed juicery) about a true vegetarian friendly place to grab a bite. Well a 2 min walk out to the left of Bloomingdales and I am very impressed.  I  feeling like a kid in the ice cream shop.  Umm umm good. Food and Service is outstanding. I was even asked if I had any allergies before my container was filled with my preferred delights. I have just two words... palate pleasing!  A must experience if you are in the area.
author: Nicole E.

description:
This place is convenient and I rather like the cafeteria style food services. Their while truffle Mac is to die for. But at the ends of the day, I ordered their mashed potatoes, which was more bland because I made the mistake of also ordering their caramelized  braised Brussel sprouts. I had my eyes on these sprouts because I love braised Brussel sprouts. I know it's speed to be caramelized but their was too much of the balsamic sauce and have three bites my tastes buds were overwhelmed with the sweetness and saltiness. I need to baked it was something mild like the mash potatoes. They also have a array of salads of which I ordered the Asian pear arugula. No complaints their.  

Fast service,  many delicious options and proper size portions. That said, maybe next time I'll order the lemonade,  after all, this pave is called lemonade.
author: Gin S.

description: Delicious modern comfort food. Had the green beans and chicken, curry chicken salad and butternut squash. Yummy! Feels healthy. Who knows if it is. But beats a burger on a cold SF day. Will be back!
author: Nick O.

description: Finally tried this place out, it was good not great. I had the Thai vegetable salad and blood orange lemonade. I think they have like a dozen lemonade flavors. The portion that the salad was a medium amount not large. The lemonade was really good and the salad was ok. The two items came out to $10.85. Inexpensive, I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Alix J.

description:
I liked it a lot!!! They just opened pretty recently, so the staff was extremely helpful and kind. 

You get to pick and choose what your meal looks like, whether that is a sandwich and salad or an entree or dessert or etc

The food was sooo good. I got the grapefruit salad and the BLT. Soooo good.

Wasn't a big fan of their lemonade but I'm not a big fan of lemonade in general.

They let you sample and are just really great overall.

Interior was extremely cute and their outdoor patio seating had heaters on their open roof top to keep you warm against the bay breeze.

Loooove!!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
This LA staple has finally made it to SF! Ive heard so much about their LA location that I could not wait until they opened here. First let me say that a lot of reviews complain about the price. Well, quality comes with a price. That should be a fact everyone knows. Id like to say thats common sense, but common sense is not common. In SF, everything good has a price. If our standard of living here is amongst the highest, why did anyone think that this place would be "cheap". If you expect "cheap" salad go to Fresh Choice with absolutely no quality at all. Im just saying. 

This place has excellent customer service. Amazing, fresh and delicious food. Indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating has heat lamps up above that are set at the perfect temperature. You know how sometimes the heat laps elsewhere seem like its burning your head off that when you touch your head your hair is hot? This isnt the case here. Plus..what other restaurant allows you to sample their dishes AND lemonade before purchase?!?! I cant even name one restaurant that permits this. This fact alone blows me away. By sampling your food before you eat, prevents you from ordering something you dont like!! So, all these reviews about this dish being "just ok" or not good or whatever... Well buddy. If it wasnt good why did you order it?? You couldve sampled it first. And if you didnt sample and took a chance well you dont know how to use your resources correctly so that is on you. 

I highly recommend this place for amazing quality and fresh food. They provide very unique dishes that would take so much time if you tried to replicate yourself. This aint just a grilled chicken cesar salad kind of place. Can you make "Watermelon radish & seared ahi tuna with snap peas and ginger and sesame vinaigrette"??? Actually Im sure someone can but how long would that take you. Convenience is key in such a busy city. Emphasizing again, quality is great! 

The cucumber mint lemonade is very refreshing. The blood orange lemonade is to die for if you love blood orange. We ordered a lot of food and spent $50 for 2 people.

From the Marketplace section:
Watermelon radish & seared ahi tuna with snap peas
Arugula and asian pears
BLT panzanella
Smoked salmon

From Land & Sea:
Shrimp
Seared ahi tuna (with orange ginger ponzu on top or on the side)
Their special of the day was a curry apple and chicken

From the Hot Section:
Bbq brisket

From Desserts:
Macaron- Salted Caramel -- which was huuge. The biggest macaron Ive ever had. It didnt taste like your typical salted caramel though. It wasnt oozing with caramel. To me it tasted more along the lines of a snickerdoodle for some reason. But I still enjoyed it. It wasnt too sweet. There was a lot of filling so you cant cut it with a knife or bite into it like a sandwich because all the filling will come out of the sides. The best way to eat it is with a fork. You are able to control the oozing much better. The macaron is chewy yet soft and very flavorful. 

Lemonades:
Blood orange
Cucumber Mint

Every dish was excellent. We sampled everything we ordered so Im not going into detail on how well each dish tasted. They were all good. The macaron was not typical so that info I had to share.

This place is worth a try. I promise you wont regret it. The lemonade alone will bring me back every time. I'll be back again for sure. They didnt have Poke when I went so I cant wait to come back and try it!
author: Sarina A.

description: Very good healthy eat my husband tried it for the first time and has changed to eating more healthy because of it. It gets you full but not slumpy feel. It's pretty expensive but good experience
author: Susan E.

description:
The concept of Lemonade is like an upscale cafeteria along with higher prices. There are sections of marketplace, leafy greens, land and sea, sandwiches, and hot dishes. You are encouraged to mix and match between the categories to make your meal. There are so many options in each of the categories that it can be overwhelming to make a decision, something that I don't like. There are about 30 options to choose from.
