Add that with the lunch crowd, confusing layout, and there is a large amount of confused people in a little area. The choices displayed looked good and I chose a buttermilk baked chicken sandwich with a side of truffle mac and cheese. To drink I opted for the carrot ginger juice and my meal was about $18. The sandwich was ok. The bread was thick and dry, but the chicken was tasty. The truffle mac had good flavor, but the noodles were overcooked and mushy. All in all the meal was ok and definitely not worth the cost. 

But the staff are very friendly and accommodating to new diners. They help walk you through the process and will answer your questions. You are also encouraged to sample the dishes as you move along, which is nice to help decide what you order. The indoor seating can get crowded and clustered since it is right next to the food area, but the outdoor seating is open and airy. There are heaters that will warm the area to combat the windy SF weather.
author: Khoi N.

description:
This place is in need of a restaurant experience designer. The process of which to order, pay and receive food is a complete disaster. 

The line puts people trying to order sandwiches in front of people trying to pay for salad. And all of them have to wait for people getting served from the hot deli. Which then creates a downtime for when employees who could be making sandwiches and/or ringing up orders.

This creates terrible situations, like literally right now, waiting 25 minutes for a simple sandwich. (Yes, they informed of the wait.) There is maybe 10 people ordering food. Imagine any type of rush. 

Why is this not fixed yet? You've been open for almost a year now.

Not worth it.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I was surprised to see this restaurant in such a small space.  The number of food presented and the seating areas were extremely small compared to the locations we have visited in SoCal.  I hope the upcoming locations in West Portal, Burlingame, Palo Alto, etc. will be larger.  Only time will tell when they eventually open up.

With that said, the available food selections were all delicious looking.  Our party 7 ordered a variety of food and we promptly polished them off.  The memorable items were the Truffle Mac n Cheese, New Mexican Butternut Squash, Tomato/Mozzarella sandwich, and Chicken Chili.

Yum!
author: Gene D.

description:
Too many options. Line was out the door the entire time I was there, Friday lunch from 11:45-1pm.

Ordering and sampling process is confusing. Free for all, people jumping in front to taste test, then moving forward... Could use some logistics to coordinate this much better. 

Went with the 2 marketplace + protein combo.

- kimchee soba noodles: tastes ok! Americanized and average tasting
- broccoli: pretty good! Wasn't sure if there was garlic but tasty!
- blackened grilled chicken: it was juicy but the taziki sauce was not a good pairing. There was another sauce option though!
- giant hazelnut chocolate macaron: size of your palm, split with 4 others and it was tasty.

May come back but definitely will be trying other things.

Didn't try the lemonade though, but friends say it was really sweet
author: Jasper L.

description: Despite the fact that I hate paying a premium for salad or eating at pretentious places, I found the food delicious and fresh.  My wife had the BBQ brisket and I had the tuna poke with kale.  The BBQ was sweet, but not overwhelming.  The tuna pieces were plentiful and fresh.  The kale was seasoned just right as I enjoyed eating it despite tale fact that I am. It a big kale fan.  If the prices were cheaper, I would come more often, but when the prices are $12-14 a person, it is cost prohibitive to rating healthy more regularly.
author: Charles L.

description:
After seeing all the Yelper's photos of the giant macroons and no one giving a review on it, saying if it is good or not, has compel me to go get one and eat it myself! I am not a macroon fan, but I thought I was worth the $5.05 price for one. I chose the Chocolate Hazelnut Macroon which is indeed the size of the palm of your hand! It's pretty firm macroon that I can hold in my hand and it won't fall apart. :-) Its appearance is solid, firm and fresh looking. When I unscrew the top of macroon, the frosting is looking very smoooth like a cake frosting. I put it back together. I took my first bite and it had the nice chewy sweet texture. The sweetness taste was just right, not too overwhelming with chocolate, but just right amount. I do must say it was very filling. You can cut it in four pieces and share it with others or split in half to share with another person. Or better yet, eat the whole thing yourself and enjoy the chocolate goodness! Yummy and all in my tummy! :-) 

Today I can here at 5pm and the line was very near the doorway entrance. I think the line to get the food is pretty narrow with everyone holding a tray going down the assembling line. The host at front said they encourage cutting the line if I just want to eat the dessert only. So I didn't feel too bad. 

For sure I will come back to try their main courses and get one of their unique lemonade flavors.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Not the cheapest fast food but for sure healthy fast food. I am giving it 4 stars as you have to give them credit for having good food and good service.  I am not a big fan of their line situation, but I appreciated a taste of 2 of the proteins before I selected mine. I also thought the tossed salad i had was good, not crazy good, but good. The others at my table had sandwiches which they reported were very good.
author: Jeff L.

description: This place is so good! I'm trying a no meat diet for a bit to feel better and this place makes it so easy! I always get their marketplace which is your choice of 4 different pastas/salad that they have lined up on the right. I get the Mexican squash one, the soba noodle, edamame, and the pasta with mozzarella. All amazing!!! Their lemonade is good but I've only tried the regular one and I didn't find anything particularly special about it. But, they have lots of other lemonade flavors I haven't tried and there is constantly lines for people just buying that, so don't take my word for it. Plenty of people love them.
author: Ruby S.

description: Delicious healthy foods! However the quantity per side is not consistent. The lady that helped me, gave me half the amount of side of the man in front of me. I told the cashier about it and he was really nice and quickly went to give me more. Good service overall!
author: Samantha C.

description:
UPDATE:
Promised I come back to actually try their food so I did. I got a combo of 2 marketplace and 1 land and sea. I took like three samples of: 
-soba noodles & kimchi vegetables(ehh)
- roasted cauliflower w/ curry(liked it and got this)
- New Mexican roasted butternut squash(ehh sounds better than it actually tastes)
So I went with the orecchiette pasta & cherry tomatoes and the roasted cauliflower w/ curry from the marketplace. Then from the land & sea section I got the roasted chicken. I thought it was plain chicken but then after I sat down I retread the menu and notices it's supposed to come with a sauce which the server DID NOT offer to me like uhmn... Anyways I tried the pistachio macaron this time and I got the coconut Apple lemonade. Total was almost $24. It was really hard to get a seat since this place gets really packed but I found a seat outside. Right when I started eating the food, it was good but then it started getting kind of ehh like I guess I got tired of it pretty quickly. But I do like the food lol. The pistachio macaron tastes different from the other raspberry macaron which is good because some macaroons tastes the same ha! The lemonade just tastes like regular lemonade despite it saying coconut Apple but I'm fine with it. I'd come back again for their hot dishes and their dessert.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Just tried this new spot today! It just opened two days ago.

Wow- impressed with the excellent service after being open for such a short amount of time. They have this placed and the service down to a science!

The line is so longgg but it was well worth the wait. This is high end cafeteria style. You can sample as much as you want of salads, pastas, meats, soups and they make sandwhiches as well!

I sampled like 5 different items- all were amazing! I ended up getting some Moroccan chicken (SO AMAZING), mashed potatoes (best i have ever had in my life- fluffy, creamy, not oversalted), and their blt salad. I also tried the pomegranate/mint lemonade. Barely tasted any mint.

Why am i knocking a star? While service and ambiance are excellent, food is delicious, its kinda small and crammed. It also cost me $23 for my lunch of 3 small sides and a lemonade. WTF? LOL. I will not be able to afford his but once in a blue moon!

Next time I want to try their sweets! Yum!
author: Erica D.

description:
When I moved back to the bay from LA, I knew that one thing I'd miss a ton was Lemonade's truffle mac and cheese. So when I heard about the SF location earlier this year, I was completely ecstatic and I couldn't wait to get some of that cheesy goodness in my belly. My craving was definitely satisfied, and seeing all these locations pop up around the bay makes me so happy. 

Aside from that dish, everything else here is so yummy. I thought a friend here, and even she (who normally doesn't go near veggies) really enjoyed the salads -- there's something for everyone. The lemonades are of course delicious and refreshing, my favorites being the blueberry mint and blood orange. Don't be afraid to ask for samples too! They'll let you taste pretty much anything on display. 

The only downside for me is how pricey a meal can get. This isn't the most budget-friendly option, but if you're looking to treat yourself to an above-average lunch, this is the place to go.
author: Sabrina C.

description: Awesome selection of salads and sandwiches. Service for me was great. They were super busy and still brought out everything in reasonable time. Great Lemonade!
author: Nate W.

description:
Cute little restaurant with lots of options to suit different appetites!

It was pretty overwhelming when I first stepped into the restaurant since there were so many choices! Once you understand the layout, it really isn't so bad.

Lemonade is laid out cafeteria style; you just go down the line and order what you want. You start with the "Marketplace" where they serve vegetarian and vegan cold dishes. Next, you will reach the "Land and Sea" section where you will find meat and seafood options, followed by freshly made sandwiches, hot dishes, and then dessert. You can order a specialty lemonade at the cashier. 

I came with a friend and ordered the Avocado & Cherry Tomatoes and Roasted Broccoli at the "Marketplace". They may sound very simplistic, but the food was very flavorful. We shared a Buttermilk Baked Chicken sandwich and Mac 'N Cheese. The latter two were not as special. I also ordered the mint cucumber lemonade, which was refreshing but a little too sweet in my opinion. Next time I come back, I will just stick to the "Marketplace" and maybe try out their meat and dessert section.
author: Crystal M.

description: What a joke! I got a poke bowl here today for lunch and there were 6 small pieces of fish for $12. The scant scoop of poke mixture was mostly tangerines, some avocados, and a little bit of tuna. They didn't ask which toppings I'd like, just piled them all when I would have preferred differently. The woman scooping was none too friendly. I'm not glad I tried this place and I won't be back. Here's to hoping these chains will release real estate inventory all over SF soon!
author: Christine H.

description:
This is a very healthy place to eat! Newly opened, and line is super long during lunch hour!!! But it is worth of the wait. 
The good thing about this place is they provide samples! We can taste the sample then order the market place items! Before ordering, they will give you a number to track the items you grabbed. A lot of items under marketplace category looks yummy! I got edamame salad and lemongrass chicken slaw and salmon! All of them taste good!
Will definitely come back to try other options
author: Nina H.

description:
Delicious! Would have given 5 stars if it had been more veg-friendly. 

Full disclosure: I came here for a free lunch before it opened because a co-worker's wife is affiliated with the restaurant. But they rang us up as if we were paying, and the core part of my lunch (2 marketplace items plus 1 "hot" item) would have been $10.40 -- very reasonable for lunch downtown. Lemonade offers a huge array of fresh, relatively healthy items, all of which were delicious. I particularly liked the New Mexican-style squash that included corn nuts for crunch. The truffle mac'n cheese, although obviously less healthy, was also a standout. Service was fast and friendly. 

The atmosphere is clean and pleasant. There seemed to be ample seating, and on a nice day, you could take your food and sit on the grass at Yerba Buena Gardens. They also have outdoor seating with heaters, a plus in Fog City!

I only subtracted one star because a number of hot dishes had unnecessary meat in them that could not be removed, and the only protein toppings available for the salads are meat. My favorite lunch is a nice, hearty salad with some protein on top to keep me going, so it was disappointing that they couldn't even offer some quinoa, baked tofu cubes or tempeh.  That being said, there were plenty of vegetarian options among the "marketplace" items, and I definitely did not go hungry. If they bring in some salad toppings, they'll bump it up to 5 stars.

Lemonade's gimmick is multiple different seasonal lemonades to drink, and they all looked delicious. I had the coconut apple. They also served desserts, and my group tried 4 different ones, none of which were that special -- but who gets dessert at lunch? I didn't factor that into my review. The lemonades were enough sugar for me!

Overall, this will be a great place to meet friends for lunch during the week, and I look forward to trying it again soon.
author: Gaelen X.

description:
This place is really great, the food, the service. It probably should get 5 stars if it weren't for Nickleback being blared over the radio...

I'll be back and put 5 stars once they stop torturing us with horrible music.
author: Mike D.

description: I love 'Lemonade' but my experience at this location wasn't great. After a brief walk, my friend and I decided to stop here for get some lemonade since we were thirsty. We decided to get the original but upon approaching the counter, the employee at the counter didn't greet us or acknowledge us at all. He was too busy on his phone. We tried to get his attention and we asked if this is where we ordered. No response. Maybe 4-5 minutes go by and another employee asked if we've been helped. It wasn't until then the other employee puts down his phone and asks what we want to order. I absolutely hate these types of reviews but I thought it was pretty rude since we were in front of him and we politely tried to get his attention. I love the lemonade and I'm a little bummed that my first experience at this location was far from perfect. I'll definitely be visiting 'Lemonade' for some bomdotcom lemonade but maybe not this location. Sorry :x
author: Misty T.

description: I ordered a spicy tuna poke bowl and although the fish and toppings were delicious the rice was severely under cooked deeming the majority of the dish inedible.
author: Marc A.

description: I dig the idea of this place. After visiting once, I think the key is to order three sides instead of a bunch of other stuff, as it'll then get pricey, quick! Nice variety of new American-ish stuff, and delightful fast casual interior.
author: Shendi X.

description:
Emegerd. Loved this place. I'm obsessed with places that do salads that go beyond limp lettuce and lentil stews. It's SO GOOD. They've got everything from hot pots to about 20 different forms of salad, plus poke (WONT SOMEONE BRING POKE TO DUBLIN PURLEEAASSSEEEEE), sandwiches, and even some sweet treats. 

I was obsessed with their coconut chicken salad, plus the ahi tuna & watermelon salad. 

The staff are super helpful and the place looks great. 

My only gripe as with previous reviewers would be with the speed factor. Despite there being hardly anyone in the queue, it still took us nearly 15 mins to get served. That's over a QUARTER of your lunch break if you're on one. Not great. 

If they could improve on that, they'd have me as a regular customer without any shadow of a doubt!
author: Emily C.

description:
I may have visited at a very busy time, but my overall impression was "highly overrated."

Very slow for "fast casual." 
My grilled cheese sandwich was completely soggy. 
Brussels sprouts were excessively buttery and sweet. Tasted like dessert. 
The chocolate chip cookie was amazing.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Really enjoyed this place for lunch on a pretty Saturday afternoon! Right across the street from the Marriott Marquee, reasonably priced, adequate portions, and delicious! Employee was very helpful with menu and ordering.
author: Alan D.

description:
This place is giving Bristol Farms a run for their money in terms of being an expensive joint. And that's saying a lot given that BF is a total rip off.

The food tasted fine, but given the choices of eateries in the area, it makes absolutely no sense to come here. The portion of the side dishes is ridiculously small given the price. I also ordered an "entree" of BBQ pork which came in a small cup for $8. I spent about $15 for a meager meal. Prepared for your wallet to be raped if you come here.

P.S. Lemonade--Scrolling with a trackpad (and I would guess with a mouse as well) doesn't work on your location pages - http://www.lemonadela.com/locations/bay-area/yerba-buena
author: Opal L.

description:
Lemonade is my go-to option whenever I'm in the area with no clear idea of what I want to eat.  Whenever I "settle" for a meal, I often end up feeling dissatisfied, but not with Lemonade.  I also congratulate myself for not eating something greasy and unhealthy, especially with Super Duper right next door.

All the food looks vibrant and fresh.  Most of the ones I've tried have been appetizing and flavorful.  My favorites are the dishes with fruit in them because I like how the sweet fruit complements the primarily savory dishes.  Examples: Ahi Tuna Avocado Poke with Mandarin Oranges, and Curry Cauliflower with Golden Raisins.

Unfortunately, some of the dishes are very spicy and the heat overwhelms those dishes so they don't taste flavorful either.  Furthermore, those spicy dishes are not labeled as such! But, all the ingredients are listed so if something seems like it could spicy, I'll ask.

Most of the lemonades are tasty and refreshing, and kudos to this branch for using a small amount of crushed ice (the LAX one uses large amounts of block ice).
author: Dave Y.

description: You know that feeling when you have a craving for something and will go out of your way to get it no matter how inconvenient it is? That was me today. Ever since I had Lemonade's poke bowl a week ago, I wanted to get it again. So I walked 20 minutes to their shop today, arrive there at noon and waited in a line at least 15 people deep moving at a snail's pace. When I finally get to order, they tell me they don't have rice for their poke bowls. How can you not have rice for your poke bowls?!  A guy before and a guy after me was ordering poke bowls too. Here's a tip, Lemonade: announce it to the people waiting in line or put up a sign. Beyond irritated.
author: C L.

description: Got the california picnic ($12) came with sandwich, side and chips. Pretty good. I had the roasted turkey blt. Good atmosphere. Not enough seating
author: JT H.

description: I've heard so many reviews from the SoCal locations and when I found out there was one in SF I was so excited!  I love the many options that they have.  I had a pasta dish and a grilled cheese and the blueberry lemonade.  So delicious!  It's right next to SF MOMA so it was a perfect place to grab lunch.  Highly recommend!
author: Mikayla M.

description: This is one of the better food options in town. SF isn't much of a culinary destination, and Lemonade sticks out in a good way. Big minus: it's overpriced for what you get (esp. size-wise). $15 for lunch is inhumane IMHO. If it were 40% cheaper I'd eat there every day for lunch...
author: Patrick F.

description: Although the line was a bit long it was worth the queue. Salads were fresh and flavorful (curried cauliflower, kale with kumquat, tomato and avocado with pine nuts and lime dressing) and my strawberry rhubarb lemonade a great springtime in the sun beverage.  I also had a delicious Thai soup with giant chicken meatballs with lemongrass in a mildly spicy coconut broth. What can I say? I was hungry. Do be careful though as all those choices can and will add up to a pricey meal when you're not careful.
author: Dionne L.

description: Always delicious, fast, and easy! Love their Tomato Mozzarella Sandwich and Truffle Mac n Cheese!
author: Jade S.

description:
One of the more affordable meal options in downtown SF!

The food here tastes extremely fresh. I loved their pickled beats and melon, smoked tri-tip and fingerling potatoes, and the ahi tuna. It was all delicious and blended together like a luxurious salad. I've had their traditional mac and cheese and that was also creamy and delicious. The portions are generous. The service is pretty quick, considering the number of people who come through.

That said, seating can be difficult. There's limited indoor seating and the outdoor seating is partially covered, meaning, it's not an ideal locale on a rainy day because you might not be able to find a table.
author: Marcy S.

description: It was suitable. Ordered a mango rice bowl and it had way too much sauce. Grilled cheese seemed to take a looooong time. Guy at the counter was supper friendly and let us sample the different lemonades.
author: Randy B.

description:
Overrated & overpriced buffet. 

Nothing was spectacular. Thai chicken meatballs had good flavor, but again not worth the price.  The free tastings is great, but result in much longer lines (so inefficient for people who work) and add to the underwhelming hype.  Like all things, time will tell...my vote with current operations is that this place is not worth the wait or dent in your wallet if you are on a budget.  Nothing was GREAT :(
Poke - fresh but bland, no real flavor
Salad - descent, nothing special
Blood orange lemonade- this should have been the star, but not the case...sad
Thai chicken meatballs-best dish, but again not good enough for a return visit
Macaroons - bigger in size than usual which is novel, but for the price it should have been 10x better...so again mediocre at best
author: C L.

description: I would give this place five stars but it is SO busy. Sometimes I don't go because it always feels like the line is out the door. I like their food a lot but it's pricey and I don't always want to wait that long. Their hot dishes and the avocado salmon Louie are my favorite.
author: Makenzi B.

description:
What a great store with amazing service. 

Came in and knew I needed to feed my one month daughter. Grabbed a booth and my daughter decided she would not latch and screamed and screamed. I'm so sorry I didn't catch the young man's name but he came over and offered us water. 

My daughter continued to cry harder and harder and I still couldn't feed her and this amazing sweet waiter (same as above) told us to sit and we could order from the booth. I ended up stepping outside to calm/ finally feed my daughter while my husband ordered etc. 

I cannot thank this waiter enough for going above and beyond to help my little family out. I am really upset that I couldn't thank him in person/or tell a manager about his exceptional service.

Also the meal and lemonade was delicious and I will come visit whenever I'm in union square. I'm also looking forward to the inner sunset location to open!

Thanks again for being amazing. I really really really wish I knew his name.
author: Vanessa O.

description: This was by far the worst time I've ever had at any restaurant or fast food chain. All I ordered was a grilled cheese sandwich to go because I was running a little late to work. It took them 20 minutes to make a simple grilled cheese sandwich. I was standing there with my number tag for a solid 15 minutes while other people got their complex orders out. I'm sorry if I come off as someone who doesn't understand when others make a mistake. I myself work in the food industry and when I see someone standing In The lobby for more than 5 minutes I ask them what they ordered and tell them where their food is. 0/10 the grilled cheese wasn't even good. They didn't even say sorry
author: Viraj N.

description:
Store was understaffed in the afternoon. I ordered  sandwich, but there are no servers to pick up the order and no one thought to at least tell those waiting for orders to inquire at the cashier. 

This location needs a bit more work on service for a new restaurant in Downtown SF.
author: Milki M.

description: I was curious about this place as I walked by and my daughter told me she had seen it on social media so, being from out of town, it piqued my interest.  I was confused about how/what to order, but once I got the hang of it, it was great!  The turkey with jicama salad, avocado and jalapeño aioli was the best sandwich I've ever had! The spicy chips were a hit with my daughter too. The cucumber mint lemonade was refreshing. A good hearty meal for a full day of shopping on Union Square.  Wish I had one more day to go back!
author: Crissy F.

description: This place is a winner. Fresh, creative, healthy and fast. A little pricey but quality costs. I'll be back. Staff was friendly and helpful too.
author: David T.

description:
This place was pretty bomb. Just moved to the Bay from Texas and was missing some homestyle food. 

Ordered jerk chicken, white truffle mac'n'cheese, and red paper roasted cauliflower. It was delicious. 

The food was quite rich so I was only able to have three bites of each; but I have a pretty small stomach and was eating super clean this week. 

Oh did I mention the adorable and scrumptious blood orange cheesecake that came in a jar? That was so cute and well put together it made up for the day of meetings I had. 

Will definitely be ordering (used Postmates) from here again. Was really pleased. 

Felt like this was a great value as well. Postmates delivery + tip (for five items) was around $36. Easily enough food for 3 meals.
author: Whitney J.

description: Good lunch spot-- quick and easy. Food is bougie but tasty. Kind of pricey- welcome to San Francisco...!
author: Jessie C.

description:
While the service was great, I was quite disappointed to hear their credit card reader wasn't working and that my only options were to:

1. Pay with cash
2. Let them write down my credit card info

That's information I wish I had prior to ordering my food. I mean, who wants to give out their credit card info?

Anyway, I paid in cash (barely had enough) and sat down. The food was just ordinary to me. I got the mozzarella tomato sandwich, Mac and cheese, and the guava limeade. The total was $17 and the sandwich was literally the size of my hand (which is pretty small). Mac and cheese tasted like the kind that's pre made at Safeway. The only thing I enjoyed was my drink, but food? Don't bother. I honestly feel like I wasted my money. I would be open to trying other things, but it's just so expensive. Definitely not worth the hype in my opinion.
author: Tran N.

description:
The food is okay, but SO expensive for the set-up.  Lemonade is cafeteria-style, but with high prices, ($6 for a cup of mac and cheese...like an individual serving size of mac and cheese.)  I know this location is downtown, and people will definitely pay the high prices, but if you're not careful with what you select, you'll end up leaving with a $30 tab and wondering why you didn't get more food for the price.

On the upside, the carrot ginger lemonade is delish.
author: Christina S.

description:
After weeks of staring at their menu and pictures on Yelp, I finally made plans to go to Lemonade today. I was really excited to take full advantage of the samples, and try new, fresh foods. However, it was completely packed when I walked in, making it very difficult to ask for samples, as they were busy and it seemed rude to hold up the line, so I had just one sample. I'm glad I got it, because I ended up not getting the Catavelli Pasta. It didn't seem like anything special, just your everyday pasta salad with olives and tomatoes. 

Of course after spending so much time researching, I had to get the Watermelon Radish and Grilled Tuna. I was sadly underwhelmed. It was quite salty, probably due to the seasonings they used for the tuna, but the tuna was wonderful quality, and I got quite a lot. The snap peas added a nice crunch to the dish, but were also sometimes bitter, which made the dish both salty and bitter (like me after I spent $3 on it). I also definitely got more of this than the other marketplace item I ordered, because it was in a very small to-go box.

On a whim I also got the BLT Panzanella, which I'm pretty sure I pronounced wrong when asking for it. I loved everything about it in my first bite. The turkey is moist, the avocado was fresh, the tomatoes were sweet, and the bread pieces soaked up the vinaigrette, which added a perfect tartness to the dish. And then I had a bite with the purple lettuce and a part of me died on the inside. It was more bitter than anything I've ever tasted, and I love bitter melon. It was worth it to me to pick out the five or so pieces of lettuce to enjoy the rest of the salad. I wish it came with more avocado, though, but maybe that depends on you scoop and random selection.

I had planned to get the mac and cheese and was delighted to find out they do a half and half of the Traditional and the Truffle. The server accidentally packed me a full truffle one, but he happily packaged a new mixed one for me once he realized his mistake. The cup was so full he couldn't even put the lid on, which is really a bang for my 4.5 bucks! I could have had just the mac alone and been full. The traditional mac was plain, as expected. The truffle mac was very cheesy, the strings followed my fork everywhere it went. I definitely think it tasted more buttery and just made me warm and happy inside. 

The lemonades were interesting. I sampled their blueberry mint, old fashioned, and watermelon rosemary, and ended up getting the former. The watermelon rosemary seemed watered down, in the way an unripe watermelon tastes. It would be a good option for those seeking a less intense lemonade. The blueberry mint tasted neither like blueberries or mint, but it was the sweetest of the three (but this does not mean it wasn't very sour). 

The desserts looked very very tempting, but with my meal coming out to be almost $16, I had to say no thank you and hope I could come back next time. Overall, the meal was good, but not so much so that I don't feel sad about how much it cost. I'm happy they use eco-friendly packaging, and their environment is really nice, so I may return, just for the truffle mac and cheese and one of their desserts.
author: Linh-Chi T.

description: We liked the tasty prepared salads and two flavors of lemonade. An efficient serving system with kind and knowledgeable staff. We need to try more items.
author: Fred  D.

description: went here last week for a wednesday night dinner with some friends - no line which is nice because I always see long lines on the weekends. the concept is kinda buffet style pretty much, you pick the sides and proteins and entrees and its priced by each item that you get. They have a good selection of hot and cold sides. The proteins are chicken, beef, salmon, ahi tuna, and even poke for about $7 and you get a decent amount. they also have 3 pre mixed salads too. On the menu, tehre is also a option to create your own but taht is so not true - you are still picking from the 3 salads. I ended up getting one of the salads that had no cheese ut still had pecans. i do not like nuts in my food. the guy helping me was nice enough to try to keep the pecan out. So salad aka lettuce and a thing of ahi tuna for $13 - not worth it. service is good but not impressed.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Looks hella gentrified which isnt inherently a bad thing. The food is really good, but some are downright nasty. Definitely sample the thing you want to get, because the dish can turn out to be salty as hell, or too sweet. 

Definitely try their lemonades. I love the one with rosemary. I wish they had smaller cups for the lemonade... It is far too large. This is not Texas, Lemonade!
Also, stay away from the poke. It was so nasty. 

The service is friendly and attentive. They work fast which is great. The place is clean and well-lit. 

Overall, worth going to if it is NOT rush hour. I'd much rather go to Moolicious during rush hour because it is always so empty and the food is great.
author: Selin A.

description:
3rd time trying out the different dishes and may as well be my last.
I specifically ask for a fruit salad, but didn't realize after digging in my salad I had only one piece of fruit.

It should not hard to scoop a fruit salad from a premade fruit salad bowl. 

Pricey to have a box of greens with no ingredients.
author: John C.

description:
I appreciate the healthy fast food option. And it really is fast.

I just wasn't the biggest fan of the actual food. It's not bad, it's just not good. It could have been good, there was just something missing. Je ne sais quoi. 

We got: 
- Sesame Marinated Lo Mein Noodles: my favorite
- Pickled Beets & Melon: if there was a touch of sea salt in this, it really could have gotten the sweet / salty balance right
- Shaved Brussels Sprouts & Dates : no surprises there. except that I didn't read the dates part. my bad. 
- Curried Cauliflower: super bland. super. bland. 
- Artichoke & Provolone Grilled Cheese : never mind, this was a favorite. but we know why. And this one wasn't so healthy. Not with that amount of butter at least. 

Anyways, there are a tonnnnn of places to eat right there, I'm not sure I'd pick this one again unless I was with someone on a strict diet.
author: Dimple B.

description: The lunch line was extremely long. They have a large selection of well presented dishes. You can ask for samples before choosing one. The plastic container that they place your food in is very shallow. Each marketplace cold dish is unique and made up of a variety of vegetables, cut in different ways ways, and mixed with an appropriate dressing. It seems like they have really payed attention to the details. I enjoyed the pasta but was not a big fan of the kale.
author: James S.

description:
I have only had the lemonade here and I would have to say that it does live up to the hype, but it is a bit expensive for lemonade. The drinks are fresh, healthy and delicious. I love the concept of quick healthy food and beverages to go.

When I went, the line was out the door and I was surprised at how quickly the line was moving. I would want to go back to try the food as well. I thought the menu was a bit confusing at first glance but there were several people around to help if you have questions.
author: Umang P.

description:
Overpriced, tiny portions, and food poisoning!! 
Stopped by on the way to MOMA and wanted to check out the well known LA spot. I got a small portion of the BLT Panzanella for almost $5. Literally half of the already tiny container. 
Although I had enjoyed the sample of my dish when I was in line deciding, it was almost unbearably salty when I actually dug into my small container of it. I was grateful for the crusty bread and my cup of lemonade as they alleviated some of the intense saltiness, but dang I was not expecting that. 
Worst of all, my bf got food poisoning from his dish :(((( 

Only thing I enjoyed was the cup of lemonade tbh.
author: Annamarie S.

description: You get to choose from a variety of salads and hot stuff, and make them a combo. The 4 salads I picked tasted pretty good, and cost me about $12 I believe, and I would like to return and try some hot dishes next time.
author: Zhuofan Z.

description: I have no problem paying top dollar for GOOD food. This food is underwhelming at best but the price sure packs a bunch! Ouch! So expensive and it's not even organic! Never again.
author: Sandra W.

description:
LOVE LEMONADE. Both the lemonades and lunch bar food are great!! 

Got the Guava Limeade most recently and it's sour which I like
author: Alice C.

description:
Lemonade is trying to open a new location in the inner sunset so I thought I'd give this place a chance before they moved in. I had heard plenty of good things about this LA based chain, but I gotta say, I was pretty disappointed. Let's start at the beginning. The line was sooooo long, but moved pretty quickly. Once my friend and I were in the door, someone working at Lemonade handed us a menu. We were both pretty surprised to see how many options they had. There were quite a few sections: the marketplace (small salads and sides), greens (entree sized salads), land and sea (different protein items), hot dishes, desserts, and of course lemonade! The menu also featured a nice little combo deal! It offered two items from the marketplace and one item from the land and sea section for only $12.75. This seemed like the best option for me. Another nice thing is that you can taste anything you want! Just gotta ask! This is probably why the line is so long! The Hawaiian poke was pretty good. After my friend and I got all of our food, we were told we could skip the other sections and go straight to pay. It felt weird to "cut" the line but no one else seemed to notice. We each got a lemonade. There were so many choices! After tasting a few, I chose the cucumber mint lemonade and it was delicious! It was a generous serving of probably 24 oz? 32 oz? I'm not sure but it was a large cup and for only $3.50. When I went up to pay, the cashier informed me that they were no longer doing that "promotion"... I was pretty surprised to hear that since they are still using menus that highlight those deals... Thankfully it only would have saved me about $0.20 but still! I don't understand why they don't just honor their own deal! It's even listed on their website... I know the restaurant is pretty new to the area but it isn't a new company. Get it together! 

Overall, the food was pretty good, just really small portions. I wish I had opted for something more filling, like a sandwich or a large salad. The sides from the marketplace were teeny tiny. The lemonade was pretty filling but an hour later, here I am, looking for a snack. The only thing I'd come back here for is probably their lemonade!
author: Taylor W.

description: I heard this was a "L.A." place - ok, so we went to check it out.  I liked the variety of the salad line and the hot foods line.  I got some tuna poke and the salmon avocado - gotta get my fish oil and avocado fix!  It was quite good, but it added up once I added a drink (about $20 for my lunch).  It's a busy little place, but it makes me feel better that a decent eatery took over La Boulange's space.  I'll be back, but maybe I'll just stick with water so my total is not so high.
author: Maile N.

description: My gosh how do I love a good cool glass of fresh squeezed lemonade!! This place is chic, healthy and good place to pick up a quick bite to eat. The lemonade I got was blood orange, so refreshing!!! Loved every bit of it.
author: Jana R.

description:
Meh. Like the idea of this place, but was underwhelmed. It's nice that they'll give you samples. 

Blood orange lemonade is good but a bit sweet. Tasted better watered down by meted ice. 

Also, I feel like it's a bit of false advertising going on with the sandwiches here. And I'm not the only one. Our neighbor table made the same comment. The portions shown are ginormous. I was actually concerned about it being too large. Instead, I received a little sandwhich - almost a little too small.
author: Megan T.

description:
I really loved Lemonade for a while but yesterday both me and my friend ate the poke tuna and seared tuna and we both were sick as dogs 30 mins afterwards. I almost fainted at the cinema and had to be taken out, was white as a sheet. So, i think we both got some serious fast acting food poisoning from the food, we were both suffering all night.
Except this incident, the food was always super yummy there. :( Sorry to not go there anymore, but i am afraid.
author: Irina B.

description:
Lemonade took over all la boulange locations. Great place to grab quick snack or sandwiches!
Have lot of juice selection. It's definitely my new spot :)
author: Chin H.

description: Overall the ceaser salad was great loved the blood orange lemonade I was disappointed with my chicken sandwich I order it they when I pick it up the bread is different from what they are advertising and they didn't think it was right to tell me they were out of the bread before I placed my order
author: Kentara W.

description:
Food is good, great variety. Super friendly and helpful staff. They let us try everything we desired :).  I thought the lemonades were tastier then some of the food options. The brussel sprouts and thai chicken meatball were two of my favorites.  
   
I would recommend ordering "for here" because the portions are larger than when the staff are trying to stuff everything in the "to-go" containers.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I've tried the watermelon rosemary and the old fashioned lemonade... For me, they were honestly just ok. Not terrible but not out of this world or anything. I tried the chicken pesto sandwich... WAY too much ailoi, had to take the sandwich apart and scrape most of it off. Although the sandwich was large and the ingredients fresh, the roll it came on was a hard roll and I found it VERY difficult and messy to eat. I will probably not order food from here again, especially since I felt the sandwich was kind of pricey. I love lemonade so I will probably come back just to try the sugar free flavors.
author: Tina P.

description: This is the third time I've come here between 6-7 (they close at 9) and they are out of everything!! Please plan accordingly or shut your doors earlier.
author: Liz H.

description: Pricey and the line at noon is atrocious. By the time I got my food, I had 10 mins to eat before needing to leave. Nice location as it's right next to Yerba Buena. Can get food to go and sit outside to eat on a nice day. The lemonade was TO DIE FOR. I would go back just for that. Overall, it's good but definitely wouldn't go every week thanks to the price and the line.
author: Summer B.

description: So happy lemonade is finally in the bay area! I no longer have to travel to Los Angeles for this! This specific location is smaller than the one in Venice beach, but same concept. Buffet line to order from salads, sandwich, land and sea, dessert, and more. This was my first time eating there since my first visit ever was just to get some drinks. The lemonades here are superb and delicious I am a huge fan of the old fashion lemonade. It has the perfect amount of sweetness and no need to add any additional sugar. My friend ordered the guava and it was good too! It was sweet but perfect. I could drink lemonade all day if I could. We ordered a caesar salad with extra crotons along with vinaigrette- super delicious! I ordered a roasted chicken sandwich and I loved it! I would definitely order it again. My friend ordered a crusted chicken sandwich and thought it was kinda dry. Overall, a good experience here and will definitely come back. If you want a healthy lunch and killer lemonade I would recommend you to eat here. Seating is limited here so be aware and be prepared to order for to go. You can eat outside on their deck or out in the park by metreon.
author: Danika P.

description:
I appreciate Lemonade for their ingenius idea and efficiency. I've been here multiple times since opening and we always laugh at how many females we see here, contrasted to the male-dominated neighborhood that's SoMa. My coworkers and I have concluded that it's because it's a Socal branch..

Anyway, the location is cute and trendy (maybe also why so many women are here). I love the patio seating out front and it's usually sunny enough to enjoy your lunch. If not, I'd recommend taking it to Yerba Buena gardens just a few steps away :)

The food is pricey. You can easily spend up to $15 for an average portion, but it's healthy and great tasting. You'll find anything from cold greens to hot sides and different types of meats here. Desserts looks great but I haven't tried them. Can't skip out on the actual lemonade either - guava is my fave.
author: Sally C.

description: I have been a fan of Lemonade since I tried one in LA a few years ago. So glad to see they are now in SF.  I had a delicious turkey and bacon BLT sandwich and it was quite good.  The cucumber mint lemonade is also awesome.  My only complaint is when you buy a sandwich, that's all you get.  It would be nice if they threw in some chips or salad or something like that.   But this place will do well in the SOMA / Moscone Center area, because the quality of the food is good and because they serve quickly.
author: David Z.

description:
While my gal pals and I were not treated very respectfully during the ordering process, the food was divine and extremely fresh!  It is fairly priced given the quality and taste of the food.

Yum! This will be a weekly stop for nourishment!
author: Vanessa Lynn ..

description: Only 3 stars. I've visited Lemonade in BH, Pasadena, Santa Monica and Glendale MANY times. This site isn't reflective of the Lemonades I've visited. In all fairness, the employees were polite and attentive. Customer service was not the problem. The three salads in the big bowls between the marketplace salads and the hot items looked like they needed to be freshened up. I was sad to not see Blue Lake Green Beans or ANYTHING similar. I love the red peppers in that dish. The tables were dirty, the bussing station was full. There didn't seem to a shortage of employees; it just seems like they didn't get trained in Southern California. The arugula salad was a bit wiltier than I've had at any other Lemonade location. The truffle mac and cheese was great as usual. Maybe it's just a cleanliness issue. We can't chalk it up to customer volume though because I've been in longer lines at busier Lemonad locations and they were still clean and picked up. Another big no-no was that clean, unused plastic forks are stored in a bin UNDER the area where patrons bus their food waste and dirty dishes. I hope things improve before I return to this site.
author: Carla W.

description: Their poke bowl has 90% of sauce and edamame and only 10% of actual tuna! It's used be really good and portions were decent size, but now everything changed. For $11.50 + tax you get something equal to one small scoop of protein while at all other poke places for the same money you get 2 or 3. I don't think I will come back.
author: Kate E.

description: Nothing too special about this place. Healthy and good food. Probably good for people to grab a quick lunch or dinner while at work. I wish the potions were bigger for the price you pay. Good service though. One worker noticed we had been sitting down waiting for our sandwich for a good 10 minutes and had already finished our dish from the marketplace and she went to go check up on our order and when it came she realized we didn't have any plates and went to go get it for us.
author: Courtney D.

description: Dined here today and asked for iced tea with my entree. They poured a glass of iced green tea, so I asked for iced black tea. The clerk said they don't make it anymore, for no apparent reason. So I drank water instead. Please bring back iced black tea!!
author: Dave M.

description: Love the concept! Can they open a few more locations, specifically in the East Bay? So many options! I will definitely have to return. This is a great option if you are looking for a quick service place while shopping in Union Square!
author: Irene C.

description: This review is about their Poke bowls which is what they advertise the most besides their lemonades. Most of the poke bowl is rice. Not just rice, but severely overcooked hot white rice.  Then you get a scoop of fish and some small amounts of seaweed and some crunchy stuff on the top. I picked the tuna/salmon because that's wat looked the best. It didn't taste fresh, the flavors were off... very underwhelming. Some of their other dishes look decent, they may be good, but for poke I don't recommend this place.
author: T. B.

description:
Lemonade's current set-up for ordering helps you order a personalized salad or meal from a selection of decent quality greens and meats. The heavy customization comes at the cost of an ordering process that's a little windy and confusing.

For my salad, I'd say it was solid, but not so special ahi tuna, but it had a good selection of marketplace greens.

However, the namesake lemonade, despite having a nice after taste, is definitely overly sweet.

Overall, unfortunately I don't think Lemonade matches up to the hype (and the decently long lines), despite being a fine place to go for lunch.
author: Kevin W.

description: Great food, a very pleasant staff, and decor/music that relaxes you while you eat. Truly a gem in the hustle of SF; reminds me of similar buffets/cafes in Europe.
author: Sergey N.

description:
Line out the door at lunch time.  I went back later in the afternoon to avoid the wait.  The lemonade was fresh and tasty, but I've had Lemonade that was just as good at places that weren't named.....Lemonade.

The guy working the register clearly did not know the menu or how to work the register.  Thankfully he wandered off halfway through taking our order and nice friendly person finished up.
author: Bill J.

description: I have absolutely no idea how this place has 3.5 stars.  I've walked past it a bunch and just assumed that it was a simple place...it's not...not even close.  Their menu is enormous, everything they have is fresh, the different are clearly labeled for vegetarian, vegan, gluten free, etc. and the food was outstanding.  It was fast, easy and delicious and we definitely be back there!
author: David P.

description:
I discovered Lemonade in SoCal when visiting Manhattan Beach 2 years ago. So when they finally came up to the SF Area, I was totally excited. This location is much smaller than what I'm used too. There's only about 4 booths to sit inside, and everything is outside. They have heating lamps but during the windy/rainy season, I don't think it's going to be very pleasant. It is a great take-out alternative though, but it can get pricey if you're eye hungry. 

What's the big deal? Well for those who have allergies like myself, every dish is practically labeled whether it's gluten free, contains dairy or eggs or seafood etc.... 

So if i'm a fan, why did I give it 3 stars vs. 5 stars. As I was going down the cafeteria style like point and order, I noticed that the server didn't have a separate ladle for their stew dish and used another ladle from another dish. What's the big deal? Cross contamination of food ingredients. Again for someone who has allergies or strict eating habits, this is not acceptable. 

I had questioned the employee of what she had just done, and she stated they do that with all the stew/meat dishes? This didn't make sense to me. So I had to stop the line dead in it's tracks, asking what the ingredients were in the dishes she was sharing the ladle in. She was very polite, pulled out her menu book with the ingredients listed. She brought out a new pot of the braised beef and a new separate ladle for it. Was the pot really new? Who knows? All I know, I didn't have an allergic reaction. I appreciated her honesty and customer service. 

I hope management changes their policy on how they handle their dishes in the future.
author: Carolyn S.

description: First Bay Area location! Great spot for a healthy meal + lemonade and you can sample most of the items. I like the curry cauliflower and pineapple chicken.
author: Christine C.

description: I was in the mood for a salad so I started browsing Door Dash and Lemonade came up. I settled on on of their Ahi Tunas a la carte and a kale salad. However, the Ahi came with coconut so I asked for no coconut. After I placed the order, I got a call from Jackie informing me that the coconut couldn't be removed and did I want something else. I chose another Ahi and thanked her. She called me back later to inform me that the lemonade I ordered (Peach Ginger) was unsweetened and did I want another choice. Since I'd never tried any of their lemonade, I hesitated to make a decision. Jackie said she'd send me the one I ordered plus a sweetened one, just on case. Good call Jackie. The PG was indeed very tart, but the other one was just right. The Ahi was perfectly flavored and paired excellently with the Calistoga salad l ordered. Bonus: So inexpensive! Thank you Jackie for your excellent customer service. Much appreciated!
author: Sheena C.

description:
Pro

I have been wanting to try this place for a while
The food was good and I'm glad they let us "sample". But when people sample, it means the lines start getting confusing and people start getting impatient because they are waiting to get their order.  

Expect lunch to be at least $15 if you order a drink too ($3.50 we got the watermelon rosemary).

The truffle mac and cheese was good.  

I expected the avocado/tomato dish to taste better but it didn't (I made it using there recipe cookbook)

The watermelon radish snap pea dish was interesting. Once again, I'm not sure if I will order it again.

I did not try a dessert. 

I will probably be back again but to a different location to try the dessert and there braised dishes.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I want to give them 2 stars for the insane prices. I was excited to try Lemonade after my friend from LA hyped it up for me. Healthy options that we can pick from. I was in a rush to the theatre. Didn't know how it worked and didn't look at the prices. I ordered BBQ Pulled Pork and Caulliflower. I asked can I get it in a plate style togo container so it's easier to eat on the go? He said no it comes in these individual tubs. What?? Fine! I paid and these 2 small tubs came out to around $15!! Jesus! Then I saw they do have plate styel containers sitting out for people's left overs. OMG! Why didn't he just put it in one of those! I killed a tree but dumping it in the container on my own and dumping the ones he gave me, sorry planet earth. 

Now the quality of the food, it was tasty I admit, but both was salty items. I wish I had plain rice or bread to balance it.
author: Karen T.

description: good location, good food!
author: Faye L.

description:
Lemonade is like a choose-your-own-adventure spot, with plenty of food options to choose from. There was no line on the Thursday evening I went with my friend.

There are plenty of healthy and quality sides, salads, sandwiches, and entrees to choose from. The poke and the pasta options all looked delicious, although the sandwiches on display looked a little stale.

I had the kale salad, cavatelli pasta, and BBQ brisket. Everything was tasty and portion sizes were hefty. Each side can add up quickly, so pay attention to how much you're ordering!

Not much seating indoors and some outdoor seating (bring a jacket!). I like that the park is nearby. Great spot if you are grabbing some quick food before a movie at the Metreon.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Food is great. I've enjoyed everything I have had there.
I'm only giving it three stars because it is so confusing! At the height of lunch hour it is great to have somebody there handing out menus and explaining things, but then what do you do once you get to the counter?! 
Sometimes I have to wait in the food line to get to the register, sometimes I have to move to a new line. There's no set procedure. I think the answer is to do a way with the cafeteria style. It's just too confusing and takes WAY too long.
author: M M.

description: Haven't tried the food but I looooove the lemonade here. It hits the spot when you're dehydrated and need something cool and refreshing. One star off for the ridiculously long lines.
author: Eunah T.

description: They have a really weird and inefficient way of serving your food. They portion things into separate containers   so it takes forever. And I'm not an eco crazy person but it's kind of stupid. They put my tuna, my chicken, and my kale salad all in separate containers. I asked them for a to go box and threw it all together...and it's pretty rediculously expensive for not much food.  2 portions of kale salad, 1 portion of chicken, and 1 portion of tuna was $22 and it's not THAT much food. I do have to admit though the kale salad is pretty damn good.
author: Donna A.

description: Well Diana was conscientious and made up for the bad day that I reviewed earlier.  We especially like your tuna!  Thank you for making it up to me and my team
author: Sarah R.

description: You know when you find that place that you know will become "your place"? Just found mine. Awesome fresh and HEALTHY selection, awesome service and very fast. Hooked. See yall tomorrow on my lunch break !
author: Lilly M.

description: Guava lemonade for $4. Tart, but perfect with a packet of Splenda. Will have to come back for the food and to try one of those giant macarons.
author: Cin-Yee S.

description: I've been to the ones in LA before and was so excited that they opened one in the Bay Area!! It was really good however since it just opened its a bit crazy but other than that, it's amazing. Foods great, their employees are nice, and it's in a great location!
author: Gianna C.

description:
A very good restaurant and I highly recommend. They do a kind of mix between a cafeteria style eatery and a up scale healthy food shop. They say you shouldn't be a fraud to jump the line and go straight to the food you want but my experience doing that was not so good. I came for the first time and a person on the wait staff greeted me asked me if this was my first time and I said yes. They said I could go straight to the hot food and jump the line so they lead me to the front where the hot food was and tried to order. But the cooks behind the hot food saw that I jumped, with help, and still refused to serve me unless I waited in the whole line. So to make a long story short, do not jump the line even if they say you should. 

The food overall looked very good and healthy, I did enjoy my dishes and it was reasonably priced. The coolest part is that you can sample almost anything before you buy it so you will never leave regretting what you ate. The lemonade is very very sweet and they also have free water. Should definitely try but if you are going during lunch be aware the line usually goes out the door.
author: Itzak H.

description: Lemonade is a Cafeteria type of place, excellent comfort food & as the place is named have many types of lemonade. .They have a selection for vegans & vegetarians, hot dishes, sandwiches and Of course the sweet tooth lovers are also satisfied with their dessert selection they have macaroons but I liked the Blondie bar. Love the ambiance, its bright and perky. Love the Yellow everywhere. It's really great for anyone who wants quick & healthy food. It's also reasonably priced. Very delicious and fresh. We tried the Citrus Poached Salmon Fillet with the whole grain mustard sauce & Seared Ahi Tuna with the Crushed Orange-Ginger Ponzu from the Land & Sea section of the menu. I loved the guava limeade, very refreshing. Will definitely be back here.
author: Tina M.

description:
We discovered Lemonade a few years ago in Beverly Hills. We liked it so much we made it a point to have lunch there again the next time we were in BH. Another time we were there, my hubby bought the cook book and we've tried a few recipes - very pleased with the results.

We were thrilled when Lemonade came to the Bay Area but it wasn't till early April that we made it to the one in San Francisco. Sad to say, we were very disappointed. I had two salads, one with tuna and the other with a winter squash (probably butternut) and corn. They were both good but not outstanding. There were generous chunks of tuna, but the tuna was a bit dry.

My husband decided to try one of the promotions: a special tossed salad which the poster listed at $5.50 and, with an addition from "Land or Sea," the poster listed $6.95. Our interpretation was the "Land and Sea" addition would be an additional $1.45.

We learned at the cashier that our interpretation was wrong. The special tossed salad was $5.50 and the "Land and Sea" addition was $6.95, totaling $12.45 for the two items.

The tossed salad was rather ordinary, making me wonder why it was promoted as "special." The "Land or Sea" addition hubby chose was a chicken salad, which was just okay. At the risk of bragging, I would say the chicken salad I make without a recipe tastes much better.

With so many excellent restaurants and salad options in San Francisco, there's no reason to go to Lemonade.
author: Elaine E.

description:
To start off, I came here around prime time which was 1-2 p.m on a Friday. The entire place was packed with people trying to get into line! My friend and I were pretty confused about where to go or where the line started until this pushy waiter politely asked us to go to the back of the line. Menu items a bit overpriced for the quality of food, which was generic and not worth $25 or more.. The lines again were extremely long and CONFUSING to the people that do not know where they are going. 

Ended up waiting around 15 minutes for a small sandwich, while my friend ended up waiting 20 minutes. Keep in mind, this is my first time to Lemonade and was expecting the LE-MON-ADE to taste delicious. I chose the seasonal special which seemed like a fairly safe choice because it consisted of watermelon and various fruits. The lemonade was average and nothing to fond over, like I had expected. 

Overall, service was good. Food was average. but overpriced and not a good idea to come around lunch time.
author: Sophia N.

description:
I LOVE LEMONADE!... One of the best things to happen to grab and go food in a long time.
I am a huge fan of the salads at the front of the line... 4 portions makes a very nice and tasty lunch... and I feel like I really ate healthy, and ENJOYED it!  I've been there 6 times... and only one of those times was the Blood Orange Lemonade available.  It was FANTASTIC!... The other times I have been there, it was already sold out... even at 11am.   Hopefully they will make lots more of it to last through the day.  I'll be back!
author: Bryan M.

description: I ordered delivery catering sandwiches and salads for my office, I only got half of the sandwiches I ordered and payed for. Getting hold of anyone in the catering department or their corporate is impossible ! I got the rest of my order when my office had to go back to work ! DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE WITH YOUR CATERING ORDERS. They will embarrass you !
author: Sam S.

description:
Been here twice now and I can't believe they still have no hot sauce of any kind.  PLEASE get some Hot Sauce! 

Food is good pretty good but don't come here at lunch time during the week- it's a mess.  Very packed and the process of ordering and getting your food is very confusing and somewhat stressful with people cutting you off at every turn.
author: Gustavo G.

description: I don't even like lemonade and the blood orange won me over. You can get a lot of variety here since you pay for each item. I got the tuna poke, roasted cauliflower, truffle mac and cheese, beef salad, and brussel sprouts. All were pretty good. I also tried a small bite of the short ribs. It was tender, but too much red wine flavor that I didn't care for. Come early because it gets busy.
author: Karen H.

description: Overpriced food that looks like it's been sitting out for hours! $3 for a small portion of veggies and $4 for a tiny cup of mac n cheese?? 2 stars only because the mac n cheese truffle was really good and not overly salty but I would not come back for any of the other food here. Blood orange lemonade was good as well but they filled half the cup with ice!
author: Julia W.

description:
I really like the premise - healthier food ready to go.
The more of these places the better as the competition between them will encourage better quality, service, prices and overall execution.

I got a combo - salmon with two marketplace sides (curried cauliflower and  red quinoa)

Both marketplace items were not wow flavorful but overall good.

The salmon would have been better served warm but still was good.

The guava lemonade was very tangy.

Of the healthier ready to go places my favorite is Lite Bite.

However I am happy to see Lemonade here and will surely return.
author: Matt W.

description:
For a fresh, fast lunch or dinner, this place is perfect.

They opened yesterday & I wanted to check it out as I work in this area. Very reasonably priced, fresh food, outdoor seating in the Yerba Buena park, and clean! I loved the ice tea options too. I ordered a grilled chicken breast panino and my husband the salad with ahi tuna. The people who served us were positive, nice and happy to help us decide on our dinner. Both meals were tasty, had good portions of food and were satisfying.

The food is healthy and there are options for children toon. I will definitely be back.
author: Emilia D.

description: I actually signed up just to post this review. They gave me an Americano in a plastic drink cup which is melting in front of me. They also charged me $8 to add chicken to a sandwich that cost $4. When I asked they just gave me a look. Ugh.
author: John O.

description: I wish I could give no star. I have been wanting to try this place since a trip to la and was so happy when the sf location opened. I have been dying to try it. Needless to say, the service was awful which made me never want to come back. My fiancé and I went straight to the to go line since we only wanted lemonade to go. We waited and weren't helped. Finally we asked to try one lemonade each. The cashier gave it with an attitude then helped the others in line. The woman asked to try one and he was happy to give it to her. We decided what we wanted and watched at least three employees pass our register. Not one offering or asking if we had been helped. The original cashier was ignoring us and helping the other line even though we were there first. Finally he helped and I convinced my fiancé to stay because he was ready to just leave. Not going back
author: N G.

description: Wow this place was good! Just stopped in and tried it, and so happy I did! Had a fresh salad and a great sandwich! Chicken pesto sandwich is on point! Also grabbed some lemonade and my husband had the mint lemonade and loved it. Great fresh and healthy-ish place!
author: Jacqueline H.

description: Went here twice. First day, out of frozen lemonade. Second day, out of frozen lemonade. Awful service. Takes about 15 minutes to go through the line. Food is good, service is terrible. Frozen lemonade machines are broken.
author: Dean D.

description: Nothing great, not worth the line or wait. Menu is very standard, food was ok. Not many options for vegetarians. They do have a great location, but very sub standard food. Not going back here.
author: Anisha Y.

description: i used to go to lemonade often, but haven't been for a while. went to get a quick lunch of just two sides salad, brussels and arugula and it was so tiny! it was barely half of the small container and it was light!  i asked about it and the blond lady said, that's too much already.  for $8+, you got to be kidding me. now i remember why i don't go anymore.  i can get a meal at trader joe's or mixed greens for less.
author: Silver C.

description: Delicious drinks! Had the cucumber mint lemonade and the seasonal lemonade (rosemary watermelon) and fell in love. Will definitely visit again! One star lost because the drinks were a bit small for the price.
author: Allie C.

description:
Yay! I'm so excited that lemonade is open. Great vegetarian and vegan selection. Considering its new, the staff is awesome!

Can't wait till they open their inner sunset location.
author: Katie P.

description: I don't know how someone can screw up brussel sprouts and cauliflower, but Lemonade managed to do that. The rice was old and hard, the brussel sprouts dish was very sweet, cauliflower taste like sour plum and the lemonade was also very sweet. The seats were also dirty and sticky, although the restaurant generally appeared clean.
author: May G.

description: I was really excited about this place after hearing all the hype. I think if like if you like this place, you either a.) can't cook or b.) have shit taste in food.
author: Nicole M.

description: Workers were confused and the mediocre seared tuna salad was way over priced for what I got!
author: Nam-Chi V.

description: Not great, very disappointed in the food quality. We had 3 different sides all dry and the braises were very heavy with low grade out of state protons .  Much better places in SF this is very superficial LA concept
author: Seth J.

description: Great variety, great creative offerings, healthy food and a nice healthy cross between fusion and up class cafe dining.
author: Sandi B.

description:
Super salty foods. Lemonade is loaded with sugar. Maybe OK with the oblivious and unaware
LTDs (little tech darlings), but not a good food and drink place for those over 35.
author: doron b.

description: Heard they were really good in socal, guess not here in NorCal. My boyfriend and I had higher expectations for this place. We came here at 7pm and there was a mini line. We decided to get a dish from every category and two lemonade in the end. The bill total was 60$ which is ridiculous for a few small portions of food. Go next door and eat a super duper burger instead!
author: Tina C.

description:
I got the herb grilled chicken sandwich. 

Cons:
~The portion is much smaller than what is on display
~one side of the bread was really soggy
~It took 15 minutes for them to make my sandwich and there was no one else in line or ordering food

Pros:
~The sandwich was tasty
~Chicken was moist
author: S A.

description: This is not the same type of cafeteria food you or I grew up on.  It's way better!  All the dishes they serve look amazing and are super tasty!  Of course I've only tasted 4 or 5 different items but they were delicious.  The cost of eating here can easily spiral out of control because it all looks so good you want to try it all.  To avoid getting shocked when you to the cashier, try to limit yourself to just two items.  I think the pricing is a bit deceiving but the food is worth it -- I'm definitely coming back and bringing friends!!
author: Kevin G.

description: So disappointing I literally wanted to cry when I got my food delivered. The sandwich was supposed to have pesto but it was a mayo aioli and I can't stomach mayo. If that wasn't enough I thought well the side salad should help but it wasn't a basic side salad. I got up charged for a Caesar salad that was drenched in Caesar dressing which also grosses me out. I just wanted a simple chicken and pesto sandwich with a side of greens and raw veggies. This whole experience was just magnified by the fact that I wasn't feeling well and didn't have the energy to go out and get my own dinner. All of this could have been prevented if the menu was accurate and detailed on Postmates. I sincerely hope this feedback is taken for what it is. I would love my money back but also want to help the process for those who order in the future.
author: Audrey R.

description: I guess this is a fast-healthy alternative type of restaurant where everything is a la carte. You start at the end of the line with what can be best described as cold side dishes (think veggies, pasta salads, etc.), then some cold proteins (fish, chicken, etc.), then sandwiches, and then hot entrees/dishes (chili, mac & cheese, roasted meats, etc.). In my opinion, the order of the line should be completely flipped around where you start with the hot entrees first. I choose my sides based on my entree, not the other way around. Everyone was just kind of confused as to how the process worked. The food itself was meh. I got a piece of cold salmon, and a side of some type of carrot salad. These two items plus a lemonade brought me to around $17. The food was lackluster, the organization of the restaurant was confusing, and the price point was too high for what I got. I will not be coming back.
author: Annie L.

description: The food was great. However this review is for the short Asian cashier. I believe her name is Mandy F. according to the receipt. She was rude and gave me attitude when I wanted to sample the lemonade.  Also I asked for a bag then she said that I had said I didn't want a bag. I told her that I did want a bag. And that's not my fault she hadn't heard me. She has the worst attitude ever. If you don't like your job that much then quit. Worst customer service ever. Lemonade needs to keep her in the back away from customers. This was my first time here. It's sad that I like the food but I probably won't be coming back because the service was horrible. Please replace her. She will cause the business to lose customers.
author: Jessica T.

description: This concept of this place is apparently to give you as little info as possible to completely confuse you so you walk out of there paying 17 bucks for a side salad. There was no menu to speak of, half the items didn't have prices and the items that did have prices didn't show you portion sizes, so come to find out the $7 protein option is literally a couple bites. Places like this kinda tick me off. I just ate a $17 side salad and I am still starving and grumpy.
author: Blake R.

description: Perfect for a quick bite. Lots of fresh and healthy options. Something for everyone. Tons of great salads. Try the green beans and chicken. It's got a little kick. The arugula salad with blue cheese is great. Reasonably priced. Good for a solo lunch or dinner, quick snack or with a group of people where variety is on your side.
author: Erndog R.

description: Great food, fresh and such variety, but please get your act together and have more than one cashier, especially on a Saturday evening around dinner time! I waited 15 mins to FINALLY reach the sole cashier. I was about to leave altogether and give back the food that I had already received.
author: Randy M.

description: Food is decent but this place is a mess! They encourage you to cut and weave around the lines, as you treat each station as a separate line. This caused confusion plus with the lunch hour rush, this was not fun to navigate. I also asked for a side salad, but in the confusion/loudness, the salad guy gave me a regular salad. I didn't realize this until I got to the cashier to pay and whadya-know, my tiny "side salad" was actually regular! Definitely not worth the money.
author: Melissa N.

description: Delicious salads and decent vegan choices. Would love some vegan hot options and dessert options!
author: Cynthia D.

description: FINALLY got to try LEMONADE!  This a cute little place near Yerba Buena gardens and the Metreon! Came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was  a short line. There was a lady in line that had advised us to go see what they have before getting into the line cause it all adds up. Her words were, "there's so many choices and it can be overwhelming at first." People in line wanted to try everything before getting it. You go through the line from the salad bar, seafood area, sandwiches, soups, drinks, and cash register where you pay. There was limited seating but you could get your food and eat it near the place. We got the quinoa, snap peas, tuna stuffed avocado, the turkey sandwich, and guava lemonade. The food was okay, not spectacular. My favorite would be the sandwich cause it was warm and flavorful. Also the lemonade was a must have! Least favorite would be the tuna stuffed avocado. There was a bitter tasting thing that was on top of it (looked like cucumber and a piece of poke/ radish) that threw off my taste buds completely. Maybe next time I come I'll try some other things and give it another try!
author: Jeanette Q.

description: I had the breakfast sandwich and when I two bites into the sandwich it was cold. My bf didn't want to eat it anymore but I made him ask them to reheat it. And he still didn't want to eat it because he lost his appetite.
author: Marian E.

description: The concept is good, the flavors are good...but the food is too salty by a huge margin. This is not coming from a place of health concern--it's about taste. The food is aggressively salty. A shame!
author: Sarah A.

description: Pretty good! I usually get 2-3 individual sides. Definitely on the pricey end but expected for SF. Thumbs up on the Kale Kumquats, avocado and tuna and watermelon radish.
author: Sandy M.

description: So happy there's a Lemonade in the Bay Area now! If you only want lemonade, skip the long line and head straight in to the to-go sign. I was disappointed they didn't have my fav Blood Orange when I visited but you really can't go wrong with any of their flavors - we ended up getting the Guava Limeade and the Old-Fashioned Lemonade.
author: Connie C.

description: We stopped by for dinner here on Sunday evening and it was the first time that I had ever been here. If you have not been here before, be prepared. This place is very overwhelming if you have not been here before and are not prepared. The set up reminds me of a cafeteria. You take a tray, you walk in one line past food behind a glass partition and you decide what you want to put on your tray. The only problem is, there is no list of the food offered for that day posted anywhere. Therefore when you walk in, you just start blindly walking, randomly picking food that you like as you pass it because you have no idea what is going to be in front of you. I picked an assortment of macaroni and cheese and a pannini. As per their name, they do have a variety of lemonades for you to choose from, although, they are not your normal combinations or varieties of lemonade. The lemonade I ended up purchasing was watermelon and rosemary. The worker there told me that the rosemary was very subtle and he could not have been more wrong. The rosemary left a weird after taste in my mouth and I am sure not to get that again. The pannini and the mac and cheese were okay, nothing special or outstanding about them and they both were lukewarm. An interesting take on a dining experience but not something I am looking to try again.
author: Lex D.

description: I really loved Lemonade and wish we had something like it on the East Coast. Affordable, healthy cafeteria style lunch options. The staff was extremely friendly and patient as you move through and sample their extensive menu!
author: Abby B.
