description: Updating my review after having the poke today. Wow, not good, not good at all. I thought the poke here was supposed to be tasty but someone dropped the ball. Flavorless, oily, unsalted. Bulked up with citrus pieces that added nothing, not tart or sweet. The whole dish tastes off. I'm going to douse it in salt to see if it tastes better. Would hate to waste that much money.  I don't mind avocado in poke since the fish is dense and expensive, but the citrus is a joke.
author: Heather F.

description:
Great spot for a vegan bite, even for those with gluten allergies. There were 4 different options ,all vegan, which for $2.95/serving are dirt-cheap for such a central location and vegan.Yeah,yeah,yeah...they`re not big (Lemonade....make them bigger!...OK?) but a great option to have a vegan bite on the go and not feel robbed or have your taste-bud`s killed.

I didn`t try their lemonade yet but they look ...very colorful : mint or ginger lemonades sound good to me.

Would have given them the 5 stars IF portions were bigger and the line/pay system was more effective.( why,if I take a to-go box do I still need to be in the looooong buffet line up to the cashier ???, common now,you gotta work on that and...don`t forget the size of the portions while at it).
author: Tony M.

description:
FAVORITE NEW PLACE IN SF!

Good place to grab lunch if you are in the area. Very veggie friendly and the food is SO FRESH. Sundried tomato mac & cheese, kale & red pear salad, and mexican butternut squash is the way to go. I'm sure everything else is great, but I have never tried anything else because I love these so much. They have a seasonal blend of lemonade as well. This month was watermelon rosemary lemonade!
author: Bhumi P.

description:
I probably come here at least once a week for lunch. There's a good selection of both hot and cold bar options. I usually get a two item marketplace to go and it ends up being $6-$8 which is a hard price to match for lunch downtown. That said, the hot food is also pretty good. The truffle Mac and Cheese and Brussels Sprouts are great. Hot food is more expensive at ~$14 for two items. 

Their lemonades are decent but nothing to write home about. The blueberry lemonade I tried once was very tart but otherwise somewhat very lacking in any fruit flavor. 

Minus one star for the nonsensical line organization. There's no clear separations between stations so it's easy to get stuck forever in a cluster before checkout. Also, while I understand the service aspect of allowing customers samples, it's really annoying when the line is out the door and someone is asking to sample 3-4 things holding everyone up. Maybe they should consider limiting people to 1 or 2 samples during the lunch rush.
author: Tina G.

description: A little chaotic but the food tasted great! Give yourself a little extra time because it tends to be crowded.
author: Melissa V.

description:
For those who have been to Vancouver, Canada...Lemonade is like Tractor Foods but on steroids and with so much more options.

Depending on what you get - it can be pricey as you pay per item that you choose. There are options such as hot items, salad bar, land and sea (meat proteins), sandwiches and also desserts. This place is just genius! 

Hubby and I went nuts and we got - beef brisket, white truffle mac/cheese, BLT salad, avocado/cherry tomato salad, ahi tuna poke, tuna on half an avocado and the green bean salad. Our faves were the white truffle mac and cheese and also, the ahi tuna poke which tasted extremely fresh.
author: Whitney B.

description: Clean and healthy food. Sometimes their portions are a little pathetic but most of the time they do a good job and you can never go wrong. It is a little expensive for what you get so if you're looking for value, don't come here but it's on par with eateries in the area.
author: Bill H.

description: Delicious sandwiches and yummy sides there mango lemonade is to die for. I enjoyed there pineapple spicy chicken salad. There's so much to pick from and the line goes quick! Worth the wait!
author: Korina K.

description: Lemonade has always been a SoCal craze and when it finally opened up a location in the Bay Area, you can only imagine how excited I was. I rarely go into the city but this one time I did I went straight there. I didn't have a huge appetite so I went ahead and tried their Ahi Tuna Poke which was delicious! I also had a sample of their Avocado and Tomato salad which was also great.
author: Mouang S.

description: The neighborhood is nice, you can picnic right next to Lemonade. The food is a overall ok, but nothing exceptional, a bit too salty, especially the seared tuna. Prices are decent.
author: Kinder H.

description: Yum!  I've been to one of the locations in LA, so was excited to see what they were bringing to the Bay Area.  The options are definitely better for a cooler climate: more hot dish options and heartier flavors/comfort food.  I like that you can get as many options a la carte, because I think in LA you do a combo and just pick 2, 3, or 4 choices.  It can get expensive if you add a lot of dishes, but the portions are fairly generous.  I really loved the roasted brussel sprouts and the spicy cauliflower (the hot dish).  The meatballs looked delicious, but I'll have to try another time.  Also have a fun selection of regular and flavored lemonades.  Service was exceptionally friendly and they insisted I sample dishes to make sure I'd be happy with the choice.  Definitely a nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Michelle C.

description: I echo other sentiments. I ordered braised beef, side of broccoli, side of brussel sprouts, and a choc chip cookie. Grand total $20. Good lord! The food is fine, if not a bit on the sweet side.
author: William V.

description: I am a HUGE fan of Lemonade-- in LA.  In SF their standards somehow were not translated well.  The "marketplace" area is where I typically go and this time I got a pasta salad with sheep's milk feta and olives, a seared ahi tuna and watermelon radish salad, and pineapple jerk chicken with green beans.  The pasta salad was just ok, the pineapple jerk chicken portion  was so small, and the seared ahi tuna salad had one piece of grey tuna hiding in the poorly tossed radish slices.  Everything didn't look or taste very fresh.  The line was also out the door because this is our newest location in the Bay Area.  At this point I'd say wait until you go to an LA location, the food there will be far superior.  (Are they making all the foods in LA and transporting it up here?)
author: Terry K.

description: This is a casual, healthy spot with lots of options. It can be a little pricey, but the quality is pretty high. You can sample anything before picking what you want. I recommend splitting a couple side salads with someone and then getting a main dish each. I wish they had more soup options; here was only corn chowder when I went.
author: Kim O.

description:
The Husband ordered this through Postmates. I wasn't really expecting too much, since this is in the Financial District (please don't ever say FiDi or San Fran, new ones). The portions are very small. This place seems reasonably priced until you see the portions. For two people, you should order four or five dishes. They are all like starters. 
The most disappointing thing today was the "Chicken Vindaloo". I can appreciate that not many who work in restaurant kitchens these days (apart from people from India) would even know what this dish should look like. We got something that looked like a chicken stew. There was no spiciness to it... no curry. 
I asked my husband not to call and mention this (he is English and knows his curry... he was upset), but when he did, the girl hung up on him. This place is strictly for people on their lunch hours or attending conferences. Overpriced and "just ok". I call these "desperation lunches".
author: Deirdre T.

description: I'm giving this place 3 stars for the simple fact that they don't have more locations around me because the food here is  and I wish I could eat it everyday! one of the best affordable places to eat in the city hands down
author: Tye P.

description: All the dishes are really creative and yummy. Some were a bit too salty but overall a nice place for lunch
author: Pierce J.

description: Three words - portion size consistency.  They just can't pull it off here.  It can be a decent value or a complete rip-off depending on who serves you.  Too bad - the flavors are good as is the variety.  For the price it's not worth the gamble.
author: Tom K.

description:
I give this place one star because it is super super super duper expensive!!! Small portions and expensive!

Give me a freakin break!!! 

Plus the lines are long especially during the lunchtime and on weekends. I do like to walk by and check out the hot girls eating on the patio but besides that, no thanks yous.

Recently they have had a union or company strike against them and say they are bad and they hand out flyers right outside the restaurant. Just a bad look all around.

The food is ok but nothing special and like I said, it is super duper expensive! 

Sure if you want to eat here because it's cool and trendy, do it but you will be paying a steep price!
author: Gangsta G.

description: Best poke I've ever had! The old fashion lemonade is great too. I can't say much for the other items but I'm guessing it's amazing, just from looking at it. Yes it's pricey but all good food is. I can't wait to go back and try more.
author: Cindy S.

description: First timer here, staff was very helpful when it came to explaining the line process and the blood-orange lemonade was ahhhmazziinnggg!
author: Vanessa D.

description: The most difficult decision you'll make all day... Brussel sprouts or Mac and cheese. This place literally has it all! Drool worthy food line makes it hard to pick just one thing. I'd suggest the TRUFFLE MAC AND CHEESE! Great place for lunch or picking up a quick grab and go snack.
author: Kaitlin K.

description:
Went there for dinner today. The food looked really nice but after tasting a variety, I wasn't incredibly impressed.

Had the lamb meatballs. Interesting, decent flavor with a spicy sauce. The miso shortribs was good.

However, the desserts were disappointed. Both the velvet cupcake and the carrot cake cupcake were very doughy, heavy and dry. The raspberry macaroon was large but very heavy. 

Service was incredibly slow.
author: Nick K.

description: So much for healthy! The food options looked fantastic, the place was already buzzing with a line of customers at 11:30 am, and I was excited to try this place based on the Yelp reviews. I had the arugula salad with pears, the carrot (looked like beets) salad and the salmon louie scoped into a halved avocado. The arugula salad portion was very skimpy, so when the cashier said my light buffet meal (without beverage) was over $14, I thought well even though it's a bit pricy at least I'm eating healthy!  Unfortunately, it wasn't that healthy, as 10 minutes after finishing lunch, my normal stomach of steel was in pain.
author: M. L.

description: Portion size is ridiculously small and the food is not amazing. Definitely not worth the wait and $$. This is a classic example of inflated hype for the opening of a popular chain wasting people's time and money. There are better options around the area.
author: Derrick W.

description: Had a breakfast sandwich with bacon and scrambled eggs. One of the best break fast sandwiches I have had. Nice place but on the pricy side!
author: Piyush K.

description: it's so disappointing when services and food fall from good to blah.  when they first opened (not so long ago), you can get service as soon as you walk in. no matter how busy they get.  this friday, when there's no one in line, we were standing there asking for someone to get us a chicken leg for 6 mins without anyone acknowledging us.  even though there were 5 people behind the counter.  two of the african american guys were standing right in front of us, but instead of helping us, they just kept talking on their own.  we finally got the chicken, and decided to get 10 chocolate chip cookies.  at over $3 a cookie, it's not cheap.  but used to be good.  only to find it now tastes like any "old" cookie, almost frozen dough.  so disappointing that after spending over $50 on food and service that worst than an old buffet line.  we won't be back.
author: Food Is L.

description: With a name like Lemonade I was expecting a smoothie/juice bar, but was shocked to see the huge meal options out weigh the beverages. Food was OK. They definitely offer lots of options.
author: Luis L.

description: Cafeteria style sample anything you want and the food is to die for!  I had the sesame marinaded lo mein noodles, the white truffle mac & cheese and the jerk chicken.   All three were really really good especially the jerk chicken and mac & cheese. Has both outside seating and inside seating. Staff was really nice and accommodating. It was the first time I visited this restaurant. And I would definitely come back again.
author: Patrick D.

description: We were shocked at after hearing about how great the chain was, how un-fresh and unappealing the food at this restaurant was. Huge disappointment.
author: Dana M.

description: Food good; service good; a little pricey.  Nice back patio outdoors to eat as well as the nearby park.
author: Bea E.

description: I love Lemonade! As an LA native, it's like getting a little piece of home just a few blocks from my office. Great food, great service! Their traditional mac n cheese is a must as well as their tomato avocado salad... yummm
author: Alexandra E.

description:
Food was generally pretty tasty, and they had pretty good vegetarian options.
One of their dishes (w/ the squash & corn) was undercooked.

I really liked their Tuna Poke and their Strawberry/smoked gouda/lima bean market salad items.
author: Chris M.

description: Friendly staff, great food, I love the patio and what they did to the space. Although a bit pricy for just a lunch. Wish they had cake slices.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Chic and cool new place to eat right near the Moscone center downtown. It is quite confusing to order at the first visit so have the servers explain what's going on. The portions are quite tiny and pricey. I'm sure the ingredients are fresh but the food didn't seem worth what I paid. I tried the blood orange lemonade and it was delicious. The lemonade size is pretty generous and plenty for 2 people to share. I probably won't eat here again but I'll come back to try the other lemonade flavors!
author: Diana F.

description: When I first entered I didn't know what to expect. I came here for lunch. To my surprise the food was really delish! You get samples of whatever you like to try. They have an assortment of different lemonades. My favorite being the coconut lemonade! I also love the tuna cold salad. There is a girl there by the name of "NICOLE". If it weren't for her I would not know that the truffle and red sauce Mac and cheese went well together. She was so pleasant and helped me out with recommendations. She always has a smile on her face and ready to help. It's because of her that I tip at the register. I came in one day and my meat was not cooked all the way and she made sure I was happy when I left. That's great customer service and she could teach some of the others what great customer service is? Because of her is why I return. It's expensive being downtown S.F but well worth the coins! This is one of my new fav restaurant for lunch or dinner!
author: Tamu V.

description:
I loved Lemonade when I lived in LA, and I love that they are here in SF now. Same great healthy options, all with absolutely amazing flavor. 

Portion sizes are normal. Meaning not typical American sizes. Im a 6'1" 200lb male that works out regularly, and one Land & Sea plus two market place sides always leaves me satisfied.
author: Ernie S.

description:
The menu list is very very confusing. Just make sure you know exactly what you are ordering. The food is OK same as Safeway but triple the price. So very very very overpriced!!!!! When ordering make sure to order from the Popular Items menu which starts from $12.75. I would not recommend eating at this restaurant unless you plan on spending $30.00 on up.
Definitely not worth it!!!!
author: Robert A.

description:
I had heard friends say that this was a place I had to try, so I gave it a shot on a busy Sunday.  Because of a convention, heavy tourism, Bay to Breakers and nice sunny weather, it was busy.  The line was to the door, but it did go fairly fast.

I found the ordering system to be a tad all over the place.  People ordering from 3 different areas and jumping in front of each other.  I didn't know where I was supposed to stand.

The menu was pretty extensive.  A number of cold salad dishes, sandwiches and several hot items.  I wanted the Mac & Cheese but was told that it had run out.  Ended up getting the Red Pepper Flake Cauliflower.  It was a nice hit of heat and pretty tasty.  If you aren't into spicy, I'd recommend steering clear of it though.  8oz portion for $4.50.
I also got the Watermelon and Seared Ahí Tuna salad.  This was also pretty delicious but be warned; lots of little sesame seeds in it.  Bring a toothpick.
A portion is $2.95 with lots of tuna chunks.  A great value for the price.

Lastly, I asked to sample the Blueberry Mint Lemonade.  That is, after all, the name of the place: Lemonade.  So, I had high hopes for a not too sweet and nicely tart drink.  They delivered.  The mint and blueberry work great together.  I'll have to try the other flavors next time.

Overall, worth another visit.  There isn't a ton of seating for single parties, but there are tables if you have a few people.
author: Richard L.

description: Over-priced, not good food in a good location.  I guess this place will make some money when conventions are in town as its basically a gussied-up version of a cafeteria.  IN the evening the dishes look tired and rather esoteric.  I tried the soup, which was nothing to remember, for $4 a cup (water), and their mint-cucumber drink which I left in the glass.  I won't be back.  I suggest to the employees that they may want to find jobs in a decent restaurant.  Sorry.
author: Thomas B.

description: Lemonade has been hit or miss for me. The potatoes and pot roast are yummy, some of their lemonades are delish, but a lot of it looks great and ends up being mediocre. I like the quick grab and go nature of this place which is often why it wins for me. Their large macarons are not well made and nothing to waste money on.
author: Dani T.

description: Lemonade is trying to be original, but it's a miserable failure. The line is way too long, too confusing. The proteins should be the 1st thing, not cold sides. Doesn't make sense. It's all chaos from there. Instead of one person expediting me through the line, I kept getting passed from one person to the next. Because apparently, the cold side person could not possibly be good enough for hot sides. While he checks his texts, with no customers. But I digress. It's just a long, drawn out process for what amounts to 'ok' food (it's not bad, not mind blowing either), served in small, over priced portions. Last night I paid $4.50 for mashed potatoes which probably contained .50 cents worth of potato. And a dessert of strawberry s'mores served in a small jar, which made it look bigger than the few bites that it was. Tried it 3 or 4 times, will not be back unless I can phone my order in and head straight for the register,
author: Richard V.

description: Made a yelp account to write this review: Do not order from Lemonade using DoorDash for an office lunch or meeting...Our order took an hour and forty minutes to leave the restaurant with multiple replacements (3 calls from Lemonade later), no utensils/straws, and sloppy portioning & packaging. When we got our food, the replacements were not as discussed, and the meats had an unsettling taste. Everyone ended up ordering a second lunch from another restaurant entirely, it was so disappointing on top of being so late.
author: Bekki S.

description: The food is healthy and delicious! The workers here are also very warm and friendly. Definitely coming back here.  :)
author: Celina L.

description: I was very disappointed because the salmon was dry!!!I spent $20 for my whole meal , it should be cooked correctly !!! I did however love the cucumber lemonade!! I will give it another try I just hope the salmon is not dried out because it would have been really good..
author: Brittany N.

description: OK, but pricey. Confusing layout, so it's kind of frustrating trying to figure out how to order. Best thing is their lemonade. Samples of food and lemonade are patiently provided by the employees. All the employees are very friendly and one of them walked around to check on customers as they were eating.
author: Trinh N.

description: So freaking good. Absolutely must try! The only thing not so great is the price - little steep for what you get.
author: Tyler K.

description: I was pleasantly surprised to see Lemonade in SF.  Was up there for a work trip from LA and grabbed three marketplace salads for lunch. I love the optionality of this spot.   I typically will eat two of the salads for lunch and save a third to snack on later in the office.  The salads all hit the mark.  I hope they open a location at some point in Century City!
author: Tiffany B.

description: Great new location, helpful staff, delicious food. I love the concept! Could eat here very regularly.
author: Dustin B.

description: My husband & I went to Yerba Buena to visit family this past week & we happen to see one of our favorite places,  Lemonade. Which was surprising to see, as we thought it was only in Los Angeles. When we arrived, it was just as it's always been. Bright, clean & welcoming. We were greeted by a lovely young lady who we right away explained, my husband had an gluten intolerance. She was so lovely about it. Showed us some items he could potentially enjoy.  She walked us through the entire line, I have to say, I really really liked the poke, very fresh. She then checked us out on a handheld computer thing, which was really nice. I haven't seen that at a lemonade before. Which probably helps when it's busy. When we finally sat down to enjoy our meal, she came over & checked on us to make sure we were enjoying our meals. My husband asked if there was a manager he could speak too as he wanted to give kudos to the young lady & she informed us she was the manager. We were taken aback as we didn't expect that.  We think it's so great, especially because of the casualness of the restaurant, that the manager is out there with the customer ensuring good service. Well, her name was DeAna & she was such a doll. She was knowledgeable & warm. We will definitely be back when we visit family again. Kudos to the management.
author: Victoria T.

description:
Finally had the opportunity to check out this new cafeteria-style eatery at Yerba Buena Center. We came on a sunny Saturday afternoon around 4pm following a trip to the SFMOMA a block away. A greeter explained the concept and menu to us after we entered. If you are looking to order food to-go, you go straight to the register to order. However if you want to eat in, you get in line at the food bar and order all your food a la carte. True to the cafeteria-style concept, grab your tray and then pick the items you want. The stations include: Marketplace (hearty denser savory salads), Leafy Greens (salad...), Land and Sea (fish, chicken, beef), Sandwiches (which get delivered to your table), and Hot Dishes (pasta, bbq, and specials). At the register you can order desert and drinks (specialty lemonade).  At the time we went, the restaurant wasn't crowded at all, and we moved through the line fairly quickly. However, I could definitely imagine this place being more stressful to navigate during the lunchtime rush hour.

We tasted the pickled watermelon radish and seared ahi tuna salad, the BLT panzanella, and the roasted cauliflower, all of which were fantastic and well-seasoned. We also tried the baked buttermilk chicken sandwich, which was a little dry I thought and ended up being too much food. In the future, 2 marketplace sides and a protein or hot dish would probably be a solid lunch. 

Ambience-wise, this spot definitely exudes SoCal coolness. There is ample indoor and outdoor sitting. We sat on the patio since it was such a nice day.  This place is great for lunch with friends or a date after doing some shopping or sightseeing downtown. I'm really looking forward to trying out the new locations that are opening elsewhere in the city/Bay Area.
author: J L.

description: Didn't think I would, but I absolutely love this place. The line gets ridiculous, but so does the line in any one of my favorite food places. I eat at Lemonade at least twice a week, and I don't see myself getting tired of it - way too much to pick from!
author: Roger M.

description: The food is VERY tasty. Can get a little on the expensive side as you pile on down the line. I wish they had a different way that they charge people. The place isn't so big so seating can be a problem though there's outside seating. Ive had several of their dishes and I can tell you that they're ALL Very good. The quinoa salad, their salmon, the tuna poke, but especially their truffle mac and cheese. It's all very good for a cafeteria style food.
author: Rob L.

description: Amazing fast casual. Food is high quality and more on par with a full service restaurant with made to order freshness and quality of ingredients. I had ham sandwich, blood orange lemonade and pistachio macaroon. Excellent!
author: Scott C.

description: My boyfriend and I came here after we heard that it was opened. When we walked in, someone was kind enough to explain how it worked. You can choose from a huge list of entrees and are more than welcome to try as many samples as you want! I opted for a pasta salad and ahi poke. My boyfriend got citrus salmon, a pasta salad, and mac n cheese. I was going to get the apple coconut lemonade, but the cashier warned me that it was sugar free and offered me a sample first which was great because it was not sweet enough at all! I got the regular lemonade and my boyfriend got the blueberry mint. Both were delicious! There's both indoor and outdoor seating (with heaters), right outside Yerba Buena park which is a beautiful view! The total for two of us for lunch was $35, which is pretty reasonable. Overall, really nice fresh lunch spot!
author: Victoria G.

description: I love this place! It is casual and good quality food with lots of vegetarian selections too. I have gone here two times and really have enjoyed the mix of flavors. I had the salmon which was not over cooked and another time four vegetarian dishes and everything tasted great. The large macaron for dessert was amazing, I have tried the pistachio one and the raspberry one.
author: Lisa M.

description: The lemonade was amazing, I got the blood orange lemonade and it is easily my favorite lemonade. At least their lemonade is fantastic due to their name. Though the way the line is formed is inefficient and they need to make a way for the lines to be less complicated. I just wanted a sandwich and they told me to cut the line but the people behind me were not happy about it. They give you numbers and they bring the food to you though all my friends got their food and I got mine 30 minutes after, after all my friends finished eating. I had to ask them where my food was. The food was average. I got the herb roasted chicken and it was pretty good but I wouldn't wait 45 minutes for it. I would come again just for the lemonade.
author: Michelle T.

description: Excellent selection. Fresh and tasty. Wanted sugar free lemonade and even though it's on the menu they didn't have any. So I had ice water and when I asked for a piece of lemon, I was told that they didn't have any because there was nothing on the menu that used lemon. How ironic! Also, I thought the law in San Francisco was no tax on to go items.
author: linda g.

description: Amazing selection of healthy and fresh salads and sandwiches! Very helpful staff and love the concept of the place. Have tried all the lemonades and I'm in love! Blood orange is the best!
author: Wahiba B.

description: This place is like a bougie version of a college cafeteria or carvery that serves upscale and seasonal cafeteria fare to fashionable urban dwellers instead of poor college students or senior citizens. I was disappointed in my one visit. I got the "chicken pot pie" which was missing anything that would make it worthy of the term "pie". It was basically just a chicken stew or fricasee and with a rather thin light cream sauce- not like a thickened gravy or even a bechemel. When I saw the pot of stew, I thought they were going to ladel it into a crust or at least throw a puff pastry on top, but no just into a little cup... ended up paying close to $9 for a little cup of chicken-not-pie. The next day I saw a protester out front complaining they don't use union labor, and I don't know about all that but I told him the chicken pot pie was a big disappointment. Overall I won't be going back. It's a shame too, less than a block away used to be a place called the Cravery that had a great selection of really good pot pies, but that closed down and now this place is purveying crustless unthickened pot pies... maybe meant to be a gluten-free pot pie? But overall a travesty and if they can't get that right I have no interest in finding out what creative ways they find to disappoint me with their other expensive comfort foods.
author: Bob M.
